Harbor Labs is currently seeking candidates for its Summer Internship Program. Qualified applicants should have at least an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related degree program. While the summer program typically comprises a mix of MS and PhD students, highly qualified undergrads with a skill set in computer programming or information security are also strongly encouraged to apply and will typically comprise some portion of the summer selections.

The program runs from approximately June 1 through August 1 annually, but can be adjusted based on candidate preferences and school schedules. Selectees for the program are expected to work for at least 10 weeks and will receive compensation for every week of service.

Summer interns will be presented with a diverse and challenging set of projects, each matched to the skill set of the individual. Interns will work directly with a senior technical supervisor, typically providing research, engineering, experimentation, and documentation in support of client requirements and the company’s business objectives. Past intern projects have included software design and development, database programming, web development, automated security analysis, manual security analysis, automated QA, cryptanalysis, firmware research, and medical device exploitation, among other duties.

Candidates will work alongside some of the industry’s foremost cybercelebrities, on industry-leading technology products, in a company well known for its technical leadership. The objective of the Harbor Labs Summer Internship Program is to provide aspiring security professionals with the introductory experiences necessary to strengthen their resumes and further their professional or academic careers in information security, while also performing meaningful work that contributes to the mission success of the company.

Successful candidates are expected to demonstrate technical depth, creativity and innovation in completing technically complex assignments. They will be given the opportunity to participate in limited business development and other customer facing activities. This is intended to expose the candidate to aspects of the sales, marketing, and business development components of a technology company, strengthening their professional skill set further.

Preferred education level: Currently enrolled in at least an undergraduate program in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or other related degree program.

position: 2021 Summer Intern Technology Majors - Alpharetta / Marietta
description:
Position Description

2021 Summer Intern Technology Majors



Alpharetta / Marietta

Program Overview:

Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 7, 2021 August 13, 2020 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

Job Description:



Fiserv is currently looking for innovative and motivated Technology and Product Interns to participate in the 10 week 2020 Summer Internship Program. Technology areas such as Application Development, Global & Cyber Security, Mobile Solutions, Network Engineering and Quality Assurance are offering internships; each will provide training curriculum, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning.

Interns will work with Technology professionals learning much needed skills such as coding, testing and support application software; work with senior analysts and experienced teammates; offer innovative suggestions; participate in quality inspections; support in ongoing documentation of existing process, with mentorship, and other complicated projects. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment.

Qualifications:
  • Progress towards completion of bachelor's degree by December 2021 / May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement
  • Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)
  • Interest in learning and using emerging technologies (Mobile, payments, cloud computing, information security, and converging markets
  • Understanding of development processes and life cycles preferred (Waterfall and SCRUM/Agile)
  • Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge
  • Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills
Desired Technical Qualifications, expertise not required:
  • Microsoft .NET
  • C#
  • ASP .NET
  • Java Script
  • Java
  • C / C++
  • COBOL
  • JCL
  • Oracle
  • Linux
Majors:

A wide range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, MIS, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math), but willing to train the right candidate.

Learn more about Fiserv:

To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people arent thinking about financial services. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

Were Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The companys approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine Worlds Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran

Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

FSINT

Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet. Visit http://www.careers.fiserv.com/eeo for more information.

Internship Program Overview:

Our goal is to provide a meaningful and hands-on summer work experience in a high-growth start-up. This will be a full-time, paid 10-week internship program beginning June 14th.

  • Job Type: Full-Time
  • Compensation: $28/hr
  • Application deadline: April 16th
  • Final Decisions: May 15th
  • Program date: June 14, 2021 - August 20, 2021
  • Location: Remote

About Vouch:

Insurance... sounds slow, old-fashioned, and unexciting. Exactly. Insurance is broken, and it's failing fast-moving, innovative startups.

Vouch is a new, technology-first insurance company, backed with $100M in funding from world-class investors. Like Stripe for payments or Brex for credit cards, Vouch is creating the go-to business insurance for high growth companies.

We're doing this by making insurance fast, responsive, and focused on our customer -high growth and innovative companies. Instead of printed PDF applications and week-long waits, Vouch is building new technology to solve real problems, writing policies that actually cover relevant startup scenarios, and designing simple experiences in an otherwise frustrating industry.

Our values:

Put people first. Act like an owner. Listen, challenge & learn. Do the right thing. Thrive as one.

These values are at the core of our day to day interactions and are essential attributes for all teammates we bring onboard. We live these out in very practical ways in our approach to work, collaboration, work-life balance, and goals. We are people above all else and strive to take care of each other, respect each other, and encourage each other to do our best work together.


Role responsibilities:

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern to join us on the Customer Experience team. Our team builds all our customer-facing apps including our onboarding flow for new customers, quotes for insurance packages, renewals flow for existing customers, and member portal tools. You will contribute full-stack features to impactful, customer-facing pages.

Job duties:

  • Design and build full-stack, customer-facing features to power our insurance application and partnership integrations
  • Participate in brainstorming, retrospectives, sprint planning, and team game times!
  • Build features in React or Vue front-end codebases
  • Build endpoints in Node + TypeScript or Ruby back-end codebases

About you:

  • Recent bootcamp graduate or currently a junior or senior pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD in Computer Science or Software Engineering
  • Coding experience in Javascript (any of React, VueJS, NodeJS, etc)
  • Enthusiasm and passion for new technologies and interest in learning new skills

Stack we use:

  • React, Vue, GraphQL, TypeScript, Node, Ruby/Rails, PostgreSQL
  • CircleCI, Docker, LogRocket, Rollbar, Datadog, LaunchDarkly
  • Cypress, Jest, RSpec
  • AWS (Lambdas, SQS, ECS, etc) and Netlify
  • GitHub, Asana, Lucidchart, Miro, Sketch, Figma

Nice to have:

  • Exposure to and passion for early-stage startups and/or high growth environments
  • A background in insurance or other regulated categories

Vouch believes in putting our people first and building a diverse team is at the front of everything that we do. We welcome people from different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate the diversity of our growing team.

Description

The PROS UX Team is seeking an aspiring User Experience Designer for our 2021 internship program. You’ll be mentored on a variety of techniques and tools from experienced User Research, UX Design, and UI Design professionals. You’ll get first-hand knowledge on what it takes to successfully collaborate in a design team. Plus, you’ll get practical work experience from a technology company creating advanced enterprise software products.

You may be the right person for this internship if you’re highly self-motivated and possess excellent time management skills. You should have a keen ear for coaching from senior team members and quick in applying it. Being articulate and observant is also essential.

We take the learning and development of our interns seriously. We have fun. We look out for each other. And we always get the job done. Come join us!

Responsibilities

We’ll adjust this internship’s responsibilities according to your skills, but may include the following:
  • Assist in design sessions with product managers, developers and others
  • Assist in user research activities, such as interviews or usability testing
  • Design workflows and prototypes based on business requirements and user research
  • Design high-fidelity user interfaces and interactions
  • Collaborate and integrate contributions from Researchers, Writers, UI and UX Designers
  • Write microcopy and other types of instructional text
  • Craft user surveys, analyze data and report results
  • Design and deliver presentations to an audience
  • Seek coaching and apply feedback from senior team members
  • Plus any other responsibilities deemed reasonable and necessary by management
About This Internship
  • Reports to the Director of User Experience on the User Experience Team
  • This is a remote internship with a workday based on the Central Time Zone
  • Starts June 2021 and ends August 2021
  • This is a paid position
  • This position is not engineering, marketing, graphic or print oriented
Qualifications

Must-Haves
  • Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s in Human-Computer Interaction or a related discipline, such as Computer Science, Web/Visual Design or Psychology
  • Depending on your educational background, demonstrated familiarity with any of the following techniques:
    • Contextual inquiry, interviewing, personas
    • Task analysis, heuristic reviews, usability testing
    • Sketching, paper or digital prototyping
    • Color theory, layout, design patterns, interaction design, typography
    • Content strategy, card sorting
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office
Nice-to-Haves
  • A basic understanding of common web technologies (HTML, JavaScript, CSS)
  • Prior internship experiences at software or technology companies
  • Demonstrated familiarity with any of the following types of software:
    • Sketch or Photoshop for digital design
    • Axure for prototyping
    • SurveyGizmo or SurveyMonkey for surveys
    • Statistical packages or Excel for quantitative analysis
How to Apply

Submitting a cover letter and an online portfolio with your application is required. Strong portfolios concisely describe problems, users, techniques, your individual contributions and results – regardless if your portfolio contains user interfaces, writing samples, or research reports. Portfolios may be submitted in PPT, PDF or online formats.

About PROS

PROS Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: PRO) is a revenue and profit realization company that helps B2B and B2C customers realize their potential through the blend of simplicity and data science. PROS offers cloud solutions to help accelerate sales, formulate winning pricing strategies and align product, demand and availability. PROS revenue and profit realization solutions are designed to allow customers to experience meaningful revenue growth, sustained profitability and modernized business processes. To learn more, visit www.pros.com.

Why PROS?



PROS culture and the truly extraordinary people who work here are at the very core of our success. We have a passion for what we do, and we won’t stop until we’ve delivered on our promises. We’re committed to the success of our customers. That’s why we think harder and dream bigger – so our customers can go even further than they ever imagined possible.

This is a unique opportunity to join a company that has 30+ years of proven success with a long runway of more success.

Our people make PROS stand out from the rest. If you want to be a part of something truly extraordinary, come help us shape the future of how companies compete and win in their markets.

Work Environment:



Most work activities are performed in an office or home-office environment and require little to moderate physical exertion. Work activities may require periods of extended hours, critical deadlines and stressful situations. To successfully complete the tasks of this position, individuals must be able to communicate clearly (in writing and orally), comprehend business terminology, interpret numerical data.

This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the job and the general nature and level of work performed by job holders within this job. This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position.

Summer Intern, Digital Commerce

Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is a global lifestyle apparel company with a portfolio of some of the world’s most iconic denim brands: Wrangler®, Lee® and Rock & Republic®. We design, manufacture and distribute superior high-quality products that look good, fit right, and are crafted with sensitivity to our planet to give people around the world the freedom and confidence to express themselves.

Our global community of more than 15,000 employees fosters a culture of integrity, collaboration, performance and entrepreneurial spirit. We are looking for inclusive, humble, creative and forward-looking employees with a passion for creating innovative apparel products, accessories, and solutions that are both meaningful and purposeful for consumers and employees.

Job Title: Become the Newest Member of Kontoor Brands

The Digital Commerce Intern will support the lee.com and wrangler.com teams as they create pinnacle consumer experiences across a common digital platform. This person will assist the Digital Commerce team in routine website testing and releases. He or she will aid efforts to optimize key operational processes and adopt new standards and best practices.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate the adoption of user management best practices across several applications
  • Update 3rd party application log with centralized IT team
  • Assist in change management task coordination in order to ensure changes are delivered on-time
  • Update Confluence with current standards, processes, and other documentation
  • Update Jira issues with accurate and complete details
  • Assist in website release and feature testing
  • Perform ad hoc data exports, cleansing, and deduplication as needed

Skills for Success:

  • Exceptionally clear communicator
  • Highly detail oriented

Experience/Education:

About OCC:

A World Class Clearing Organization

OCC is the largest equity derivatives clearing organization in the world. We provide central counterparty clearing and settlement services for equity options, futures, options on futures, and securities lending transactions. We serve approximately 115 clearing members and 15 exchanges including CBOE, Nasdaq, and NYSE.

OCC is building a culture that empowers continued learning, authentic innovation, and constant creativity.

About the Intern Program:

OCC is looking for interns who are hungry for the chance to learn more, humble enough to admit they don’t know all the answers, and smart enough to recognize the opportunity. The OCC Internship Program provides students with the real-world skills to successfully transition into a career in the financial services industry. As an intern, you will help lead projects that help shape the future of OCC. This person will apply their skill-set and knowledge toward tackling designated projects. This an exciting opportunity to have a true impact on the company by designing and implementing solutions for real challenges facing the business. Here’s what we’re looking for:

Projects and Responsibilities:
  • As a key member of the Enterprise Technology Solutions (ETS) Integrations team, the intern will primarily support integration automation, design, and testing between OCC’s SaaS/PaaS applications while collaborating with various OCC stakeholders on project work.
  • During project work the intern will be responsible for demonstrating an understanding of the end-to-end integration components and work cross-functionally to test that components are stable under test cases / scenarios. Additionally, they will assist with integration error identification, root cause analysis, and the implementation of permanent / sustainable solutions.
  • To aid in collaboration, we will leverage Slack and WebEx.
Collaboration:
  • Collaborate with Technology Engineering team to migrate integration artifacts from The OCC’s middleware servers to cloud-based infrastructure in support of PM0-566 - Future Data Center project.
  • Collaborate with The OCC’s Security teams to automate notification and cycle privileged passwords using CyberArk password management vault and ServiceNow (Accounts Lifecycle Management).
  • Collaborate with The OCC’s Security teams integrate ETS systems with Splunk to support security analytics, monitoring and anomaly detection and improve The OCC’s security posture.
  • Engage with The OCC’s PMO group to build Project metadata integrations to support the Project Costing enhancement efforts at The OCC in Oracle and Concur systems. This will save Accounting team labor hours to reduce their manual maintenance of Project data.
Candidate Qualifications:
  • Must be pursuing a degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or have experience and passion for working with large data sets and / or automating data transmission
  • Experience at working both independently and in a collaborative environment.
  • Experience with MS Excel and Powerpoint.
  • API / ETLTools, SQL, and Oracle ERP / EPM experience, is a plus
What knowledge and skills will the intern gain from this internship?
  • An understanding of enterprise SaaS integration utilizing cloud infrastructure tools
  • Knowledge of OCC's ETS applications that support Finance, Accounting, Treasury, Strategic Sourcing, along with their database schemas, configurations, data, and metadata structures
  • Improved ETL and integration development skills
  • Strong understanding of Data Governance and Security requirements that underpin enterprise application development
  • Communication and presentation skills to cross-functional teams and senior management

You will receive an email notification to confirm that we've received your application.

Step 3
If you are called in for an interview, a representative from OCC will contact you to set up a date, time, and location.

For more information about OCC, please click here.

OCC is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Join Impinj and help us realize our vision of boundless IoT—trillions of things connected to the Internet. We’re inventing ways to bring all things online—including apparel, automobile parts, medical supplies, and luggage. With over 50 billion things connected to date, our platform has been used around the world. Together with our partners and customers, we solve for a better understanding of our world and how things move through it. If it’s a thing, we’re working to connect it.

The Software Test and Quality (STaQ) team is looking for an intern who is excited about using their programming skills to improve product quality, gain new insights into product performance, and delve into and extract the data generated by our automation systems.

As an intern on the STaQ team, you will develop software for the purposes of product testing from end-to-end: gathering requirements, building designs, implementing, testing, demonstrating, delivering, and iterating. Our test team is a closely-knit group that works with the development team on a daily basis to improve quality processes: from understanding and capturing product requirements, to developing test plans, delivering test capabilities, and writing tests. We also spend time with developers analyzing results and handling incoming customer queries and/or issues.

What you’ll need to be considered for this role:

Bonus:

Why work at Impinj:

Impinj provides an environment that fosters openness and innovation and is developing technology that delivers a positive impact on the world. Collaboration and teamwork are highly valued, and accomplishments are duly celebrated. We have an open paid time-off policy paired with a respect for work/life balance. Our headquarters is located in Seattle with spectacular views of the Olympics, Lake Union, and Mt Baker, which can be enjoyed from our rooftop deck. Impinj is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds.

We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. A world leader in the field of in vitro diagnostics for over 55 years, bioMérieux conceives, develops, produces and markets diagnostics solutions (systems, reagents, software and services) intended for clinical and industrial applications, which determine the origin of a disease or a contamination to improve the health of patients and insure consumer safety. bioMérieux is present in 44 countries and serves more than 160 countries with the support of a large network of distributors. Its corporate headquarters are located in Marcy l’Étoile, near Lyon, in France. Joining bioMérieux is choosing to be a part of an innovative company with a long term vision, committed to the service of public health and carried out with a humanist corporate culture. Our Company offers numerous opportunities for professional development. You want to help save lives across the globe? Join the 12,000 employees of bioMérieux!

The job of the GCS Co-Op Application Specialist (bMx Job 12734) is to support the Global Customer Support Expert Unit in the design and development of effective tools, digital content, and conventional training materials in order to train and assist field teams in their mission to support medical device products.   • Familiar with microbiology laboratory practices is a plus

Working at bioMérieux means being involved long term with a pioneering, visionary and constantly growing company that allows its employees to live a stimulating and inspiring experience in a fulfilling work environment. We provide a rewarding experience in an international company that brings together talents from diverse backgrounds, thus fostering a daily aspiration to go beyond the limits. Helping improve public health around in the world: our mission gives purpose to every profession practiced within the company.

position: Computer Science/Electrical Engineering Development Summer Intern V
description:
About our group:

We lead Seagate's consumer product division focusing on next-gen data storage and user experience.

About the role - you will:

Areas of Interest: NVMe, USB3.1 Gen 1/2, Thunderbolt, SATA, SAS, Fiber Channel, 10G Ethernet, RAID, Debug, System Performance Test, Python

Are you an Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering undergrad student seeking an exciting summer 2021 internship and looking for an opportunity to leave a lasting impression in the consumer space?

We are looking for students ready to roll up their sleeves and help build game-changing products over the course of a 12 week summer internship at our Fremont Research Center. We are looking for students excited to help solve big problems and join a team with equally motivated co-workers. This is an awesome opportunity to work on early stage product development, solving real consumer issues. Responsibilites include:

  • Have the opportunity to help develop, test, and debug our cutting edge Consumer Electronic and Data Center Products
  • Help to characterize system performance and usage models for various storage technologies, propose methods to optimize data throughput
  • Support Research activities for other Advanced Development projects

Our summer interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate. Weekly communications with overseas design teams may be necessary.


About you:

Our ideal intern candidate must be a self-directed team player who thrives in a continually changing environment and has the following attributes and experience:
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering and returning to school in fall 2021
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment are essential to succeed in this role.
  • Great interpersonal skills and the ability to build consensus is a must
  • Excellent analytical and debug skills
  • Strong Electrical/Computer Engineering fundamentals with demonstrated ability to apply these skills to solve difficult real world problems
  • Experience with Network System Performance Testing and Script Writing a plus
  • Experience with various OS such as Linux, Unix, Windows and MacOS a plus
  • Experience with NVMe, USB3.1 Gen 1/2, Thunderbolt, SATA, Debug, System Test a plus
  • Experience with high speed interfaces and Hardware Testing a plus


Location:

Location: Fremont, CA

Our Gold LEED-certified Fremont product-design campus drives innovation, bringing together a diverse set of engineering, design, operations, support and administrative teams. The site is equipped with state-of-the-art clean room and lab space. On-site social activities are popular, including our annual BBQ, ice cream social, and holiday events. Wellness programs, gaming rooms and the on-site fitness center help round out and balance your Seagate work-life experience, along with opportunities to give back to our local community.

Becht is a 5 STAR rated Glassdoor, a Top 100 Best Places to Work in New Jersey according to NJBIZ and a Great Place to Work-Certified™ company!
Please attach a recent unofficial transcript with your resume. If you are a Master's degree student, please also upload your Bachelor's degree transcript. Failure to do so will create a delay in the review of your application.

Who is Becht?
Founded in 1964, Becht is a rapidly-growing, multi-discipline consulting firm relied on by customers to relentlessly solve their most difficult and entrenched problems. We combine vast experience through our network of over 1500 technical experts with both engineering expertise and professional experience. Becht is a company founded on excellence, and as such we seek individuals who want to be part of our passionate and energetic team.

Who Do We Want?
Becht is seeking junior, senior, master’s or doctorate computer science/software engineering students with interest in web app development with a database back end who want to learn more by joining our world-class, family-owned engineering organization. Becht is committed to developing young professionals by providing opportunities to explore the dynamic environment of engineering consulting services. Becht strives to provide the student with:
• Real world experience with a consulting company operating with the latest technology

At Becht, our intern/co-op program gives students the opportunity to explore the practical applications of their college classes while working with customers from around the globe. We offer full-time student positions for every semester. These positions actively support current projects and are constantly evolving. As a student with Becht, you will learn to develop internal and client facing web apps, web pages, and productivity tools with a team of other software developers and engineers. You will be involved in the entire process from setting application requirements, creating data models, and designing the interface, developing the front and back ends, testing and assisting in deployment. You will be at the forefront of our most advanced and technically rewarding projects to assist clients in improving reliability and profitability while also reducing risks to people and the environment.

Build Your Career with Becht
A creative and innovative work environment isn’t all we have to offer! When you join Becht, you can expect:
• A positive, collaborative workforce
• Access to further training and development
• Mentoring programs
• Company and family events such as baseball games, go-karting, and bowling
• Opportunities that provide stability as well as variety
• Work day events such as birthday lunches
• Community outreach programs such as Red Cross blood drives, Toys for Tots collections/volunteering, and United Way campaigns

Your Knowledge and Expertise
• Passion for technology and can navigate across complex and rapidly changing landscapes
• Detail oriented and organized
• Creative and confident to express new ideas
• Proven troubleshooting skills
• Self-motivated and self-disciplined
• Should be comfortable working in a virtual team
• Ability to compartmentalize efforts—put one task down, pick up another, then resume the first with minimal ramp up required
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Object oriented programming experience
• Database experience
• MSSQL, Bootstrap, C# and/or .NET Core experience are a plus.
• Must be enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent, degree
• Must be available to work 40 hours per week for a minimum of one semester

Who is Becht?
Founded in 1964, Becht is a rapidly-growing, multi-discipline consulting firm relied on by customers to relentlessly solve their most difficult and entrenched problems. We combine vast experience through our network of over 1500 technical experts with both engineering expertise and professional experience. Becht is a company founded on excellence, and as such we seek individuals who want to be part of our passionate and energetic team.

Who Do We Want?
Becht is seeking junior, senior, master’s or doctorate computer science/software engineering students with interest in web app development with a database back end who want to learn more by joining our world-class, family-owned engineering organization. Becht is committed to developing young professionals by providing opportunities to explore the dynamic environment of engineering consulting services. Becht strives to provide the student with:

  • Guidance in the form of a highly trained mentor
  • A positive, team approach work environment
  • Hands on experience with the full SDLC during your internship

At Becht, our intern/co-op program gives students the opportunity to explore the practical applications of their college classes while working with customers from around the globe. We offer full-time student positions for every semester. These positions actively support current projects and are constantly evolving. As a student with Becht, you will learn to develop internal and client facing web apps, web pages, and productivity tools with a team of other software developers and engineers. You will be involved in the entire process from setting application requirements, creating data models, and designing the interface, developing the front and back ends, testing and assisting in deployment. You will be at the forefront of our most advanced and technically rewarding projects to assist clients in improving reliability and profitability while also reducing risks to people and the environment.

Build Your Career with Becht
A creative and innovative work environment isn’t all we have to offer! When you join Becht, you can expect:

We all depend on healthcare throughout our lifetimes, for ourselves, and our families and friends, but it is notoriously difficult to navigate and understand. As an industry that comprises 20% of the US economy we think healthcare should work better for all of us. At Collective Health we believe it's time for a new day in healthcare where as members we are informed and empowered to make the right care choices when the decisions are urgent and critical.

As an engineering intern at Collective Health, you'll develop systems that allow us to analyze trends, power our web portals, manage user data, process insurance claims, and keep our data secure. Our tech stack is a distributed system of Java, Python, AWS Technologies. Our infrastructure is based on Spark, Databricks, Airflow, AWS S3, AWS Glue. We've got a ton of interesting problems to solve around distributed systems, data, analytics and predictions, system reliability, security, privacy, and more.

Interns at Collective Health are involved in every aspect of our software development lifecycle, including designing systems, writing code, and deploying to production. As an intern, you'll be assigned a mentor who will help you learn about engineering at Collective Health and help you grow and improve as an engineer. Our engineering culture is collaborative and supportive, and we value learning from each other. We care deeply about diversity and inclusion and have worked to build a diverse team where everyone feels respected and supported.

About the team:



You will be working with a team of engineers that are responsible for the Data Infrastructure in Collective Health. It is a small dynamic team with a strong focus on data. You will learn to work with big data tools like Spark, Databricks, Airflow, AWS Cloud technologies in addition to Java, Python languages. You will be part of a team that is responsible for creating the next generation data infrastructure to move data to and from external clients, partners, and internal users with the goal of improving healthcare.

About you:



We're looking for interns who are proficient in an Object-Oriented programming language, such as Java or Python. We prefer interns to have completed at least one software development internship before who are passionate about data and infrastructure to solve hard problems for everyone. We are looking for interns who are willing to learn, strive to improve, and excited to make a difference in health insurance in the US.
Collective Health is a technology company simplifying employer healthcare to make health insurance work for everyone. With more than a quarter million members and over 60 enterprise clients—including Pinterest, Red Bull, Restoration Hardware, Box, Activision Blizzard, and more—our technical and customer experience teams are reinventing the healthcare experience for forward-thinking employers and their people across the U.S.

Collective Health is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, with additional offices in Chicago, IL, and Lehi, UT. Founded in 2013, Collective Health is backed by the SoftBank Vision Fund, DFJ Growth, PSP Investments, NEA, GV, G Squared, Founders Fund, Maverick Ventures, Mubadala Ventures, Sun Life, and other leading investors. For more information, visit us at https://www.collectivehealth.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Collective Health is committed to providing support to candidates who require reasonable accommodation during the interview process. If you need assistance, please reach out to recruitingaccommodations@collectivehealth.com.

Collective Health

Ultimately, you are not just an intern here at Nelnet. You are a pivotal, necessary addition to our teams. Whether you are an innovator, tech-expert, problem-solver, or beyond – you have the unique skillset to be a change-maker at Nelnet.

Software Engineer Interns will enhance and support our internal and external web-based applications. Interns will contribute meaningfully to a team that builds technology products. An agile team that is focused on developing software that provides significant operational efficiencies and a modern technology experience to our business partners.

  • Collaborate with technology experts

EXPERIENCE:

COMPETENCIES – SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES:

This position requires work in support of the Company’s contract with the United States Department of Education (“ED”). Collins Aerospace, a Raytheon Technologies company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.

We make modern flight possible for millions of travelers and our military every second. Our major product lines are on-board virtually every aircraft flying. Be it keeping passengers safe with our emergency power generation systems, or creating a positive in flight experience through reliable cabin pressure controls and quieter engines, Power & Controls focuses on delivering a best-in-class experience to our customers. Job Description


Join our Intel Fab Construction Enterprise (FCE) who builds the world's largest semiconductor manufacturing factories across the globe.

The future is what we build. Our enterprise manages a portfolio of capital projects on-site with a large contractor workforce that encompasses outsourced general contractors, A/E Architecture and Engineering firms, and key trade companies in the Semiconductor Construction Industry.

We are looking for world-class diverse technical talent to join our team.

If you enjoy working with the latest technology in a rewarding, fast-paced environment, this is the right place for you. Everywhere you go, you'll find an opportunity to make a difference. In any given workday, you will be given the responsibility to innovate and create an impact on our business.

As part of FCE's Digital Transformation initiative, the organization is transitioning to cloud-based systems and technologies. This requires a completely different set of skills for laying the foundation to enable end-to-end systems for delivering fab construction cost, schedule, and predictability improvements.

This is a remote full-time internship.

As a Data Engineering Intern, the scope of our work includes the following responsibilities but is not limited to:

  • Progressive Build, tool Install, new factories, and site infrastructure.

  • Translate data into information and enable business strategy, improve operations, or otherwise unlock business value.

  • Tell a compelling story with data and visualizations that helps others see possibilities and solutions.

The successful candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:

  • Software, data, and/or analytics skills to help implement solutions for construction-related projects, including developing new capabilities using Azure services.


Qualifications


You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience would be obtained through a combination of prior education level classes, and current level school classes, projects, research, and relevant previous job and/or internship experience.

This position is not eligible for employment-based visa/immigration sponsorship. Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's or Ph.D. degree, or a Bachelor’s degree with three years’ related job experience. This position does not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that only requires a Bachelor’s degree and less than three years’ experience.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • The candidate must be pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a closely related field.

  • 2+ month of experience with:

    • T-SQL.

    • Power BI, or similar data visualization software

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with Quickbase development and integration

  • Experience building SASS tabular models and writing basic DAX formulas.

  • Experience using the following technologies or programming languages: software and web development including APIs, Javascript, C#/.NET, and/or Python. SQL Server/Relational Databases, Microsoft BI stack (DAX, Power BI, Power Query).

Inside this Business Group


As the world's largest chip manufacturer, Intel strives to make every facet of semiconductor manufacturing state-of-the-art - from semiconductor process development and manufacturing, through yield improvement to packaging, final test and optimization, and world class Supply Chain and facilities support. Employees in the Technology and Manufacturing Group are part of a worldwide network of design, development, manufacturing, and assembly/test facilities, all focused on utilizing the power of Moore’s Law to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth

The program consists of both classroom training and hands-on experience in a lab environment.

This internship requires part-time on site participation in Springfield, Missouri Monday through Friday from 1PM to 5PM starting Monday, May 24, 2021. After the initial 12 week training period, interns transition to more flexible part time hours with an assigned development team. This internship is designed to be an ongoing opportunity for professional development as long-term team members of O'Reilly Auto Parts.

Under direct supervision, a Software Developer Intern develops, tests, and documents computer software, applying knowledge of programming techniques and computer systems.

Essential Job Functions
• Debug and correct software defects.
• Develop new or modify existing software.
• Create or update project documentation.
• Test software to validate accuracy of code.

Skills and Qualifications
• High School diploma or equivalent.
• Entry level knowledge of programming, database systems, and systems analysis and design.
• Ability to write technical documentation.
• Good problem-solving skills.
• Good verbal and written communications skills.
• Must work well in a team environment.
• Ability to learn independently.

Desired
• Computer-related work experience is an advantage.

Benefits

All full time team members are eligible for a benefits package that is designed to offer convenience and security to our team members and their families. Programs, resources and benefit eligibility varies based on employment status, average hours worked, location and length of service. For detailed benefits info, please click here or type http://bit.ly/ORLYBenefits in your browser.

What is iManage U?

**Please note: We are currently working remotely until it is deemed safe and appropriate to return to our downtown Chicago office.

iManage U provides students the chance to experience a dynamic, rapid growth technology company firsthand. iManage will provide a structured program which delivers project-based activities, improved knowledge of business fundamentals, tackling complex problem solving, collaboration, team building, and some fun experiences along the way! This year, our paid internship program will kick-off on Monday, June 7th and will run through Friday, August 13th.

Goals of the Program:
  • iM Making An Impact: Leave your mark on your team by owning and completing assigned projects
  • iM A Mentee: Learn from teammates across departments & gain perspectives from a diversity of people
  • iM A Connector: Meet & connect with as many interns and iManage employees as possible
  • iM Inspired: Learn from our leadership team and ask questions during our virtual lunch and learns
  • iM Social: Enjoy virtual events, and everything iManage has to offer this summer
Being an intern in our Technology Group team means.

Joining our team of energetic Software Engineers where you will focus on web developed projects, assisting in the development of our product that is the core of iManage, and is used by millions of professionals all over the globe! You will be immersed within our agile team where you will have the opportunity to learn new programming languages, as well as assist in the creation of new system features that will directly impact our solutions!

iM Responsible For...
  • Developing and maintaining front end aspects of our core products
  • Collaborating with cross-functional engineering teams (QA, UX/UI, development)
  • Working alongside our team to develop new extensions that expand our core products into customer owned systems
  • Helping implement new system designs as well as upgrade products the most up-to date versions
  • Encouraging software engineering best practices (e.g. unit testing, code reviews, design documentation) and gaining exposure to JavaScript, VS code, Docker, Angular, Webpack, LESS, CSS, Bootstrap, REST, etc.
iM Qualified Because I Have
  • Been pursuing a bachelors degree in Computer Science or other technology related field
  • Experience working with object-oriented technologies (C++, Java, Python, etc.)
  • Knowledge of web technologies (JavaScript, Angular, React, CSS, HTML, etc.)
  • Experience with Mac/Windows operating systems
  • Strong desire to enhance programming skills and learn new frameworks
  • Solid understanding of Computer science fundamentals
  • Excellent written and communication skills
About iManage

iManage combines artificial intelligence with content and email management to free, secure, and understand information. Over 3000 companies and 1 million users worldwide rely on our market-leading software to share and protect their most valuable data. Our work is not always easy but it is ambitious and rewarding.

So were looking for people who love a challenge. People who are happiest when theyre solving problems and collaborating with the industrys best and brightest. In exchange, well make sure the work you do here is worth doing. Thats the iManage way. Its how we do things that might appear impossible. How we develop our employees strengths and unlock their potential. Its how we find meaning in everything we do.

Whoever you are, whatever you do, however you work. Make it mean something at iManage.

Learn more at: www.imanage.com

Please see our privacy statement for more information on how we handle your personal data: https://imanage.com/privacy-policy/

At the Hawthorne Gardening Company (HGC) we want our people to empower more people to garden no matter where and how they choose to grow. We accomplish this by encouraging people to live happier, healthier lives through gardening. If you also feel this way then you’d fit in great with us!

Job Overview:

In this position you will assist the Process Engineering Center of Excellence in developing robotic process automation (RPA). You will be using existing design documents provided by other team members to build the automation, test the automation, work with business analysts to obtain user acceptance, and move the automation to the production environment. You will be following standards and procedures developed by the team for properly documenting testing results and moving automation through the development process. You will be a member of a highly collaborative and fast-paced team that is intensely focused on process design and enabling efficiencies that enable the Scotts Miracle-Gro business to grow and deliver ever-improving products and services to our customers.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Review process design documentation

  • Develop automation using Robotic Process Automation (RPA) tools such as UIPath

  • Test that automation to ensure operation aligns with business requirements

  • Collaborate with business analysts to ensure the business is aligned with the automation output

  • Review information and trends to ensure that the output of automation is achieving the desired results and that services are meeting any available/agreed upon service levels

  • Identify automation related issues and risks

  • Monitoring, measuring and providing feedback on automation performance

Minimum Qualifications:

Education level:

  • Sophomore or later in Bachelor’s degree program in information technology, operations, computer science, or a business management.

Specific skills:

  • Willingness to be a creative problem solver.

  • Acute awareness for organizational and time management skills.

  • Excellent communication and team collaboration.

  • Ability to program in Python and other development languages.

  • Basic understand of UiPath is a plus.

  • Ability to consistently and clearly communicate verbally and in writing with a variety of audiences is a plus.

  • Ability to work independently as well as a member of a highly-collaborative teams including those outside of IT.

  • Excellent planning and prioritization skills to enable consistent and timely delivery of work products is a huge plus.

Certifications:

  • NA

Licenses:

  • NA

Physical abilities:

  • Ability to work effectively in a physical and virtual office environment.

Our commitment to Live Total Health puts the wellness and safety of our associates and their families as the top priority. Throughout the COVID-19 pandemic, ensuring associate safety has been a primary focus for all of us at Scotts. During this year’s flu season and the continuing pandemic, we remain committed to doing everything we can to keep our associates healthy and safe. As such, we are requiring our US associates to get a flu vaccine. This safety measure will help protect our associates, our families and our communities. We recognize a medical or personal circumstance may prevent you from meeting this requirement and we have a process to address those concerns.

Job Title:
Intern, Data Engineering
Job Description:

Position Overview

Autodesk is looking for enthusiastic students who are interested in Data Engineering. You'll be improving critical data processing & analytics pipelines and researching innovative ways to transform data into insights. As a Summer 2021 Data Engineering intern, you will get to apply your knowledge in data engineering, work with the interesting data sets, and make an impact by helping our customers create a better, safer, more sustainable world.

Responsibilities
  • Help define and drive execution of the data engineering roadmap
  • Develop, test and deploy new data pipelines to support customer requirements and fix defects and implement enhancements
  • Develop processes and techniques for practicing good data hygiene to ensure data is always up-to-date, accurate, and stored efficiently
  • Apply expertise in aggregating multiple data sources to creating complex SQL queries and reusable solutions
Minimum Qualifications
  • Student must be at least 18 years of age
  • Student must be actively enrolled in a degree granting academic institution or accredited boot camp at the time of internship.
  • Students should reside and attend university in the country where the internship is being offered
  • A mix of previous internship, school project, volunteer and leadership experience is also important
Preferred Qualifications
  • Pursuing a Masters or PhD in Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Information Science, Data Engineering, Analytics, Machine Learning, Physical Sciences, or a related field
  • Proficiency in SQL, Python
  • Knowledge in AWS, CI/CD, GIT, Jenkins
  • Good communication and teamwork skills
  • Strong desire to learn and experiment
  • Experience with large datasets and large scale analytics
About the US Intern Program

The U.S. program runs from May through August for 12 weeks and will be remote (subject to change). All internships are paid. Interns have the opportunity to work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in intern events such as TED talks, mentoring, fun events, and more. US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March.

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers.

position: Software Intern - Wireless and Connectivity Integration (Summer 2021)
description:
Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what's possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.

Internship Term: Summer 2021
Rivian internships are experiences optimized for student candidates. To be eligible, you must be an undergraduate or graduate student in an accredited program during the internship term. If you are not pursuing a degree, please see our full time positions at Rivian.com/careers

Note that if your university has specific requirements for internship programs, it is your responsibility to fulfill those requirements.

This is what you will do:

As an intern focusing on wireless and connectivity integration for the Connectivity team at Rivian, you will work alongside software developers, system integrators, and feature owners to support wireless and connectivity feature development by focusing on data analysis of telemetry data obtained from our fleet of development vehicles. This data includes WiFi, cellular, Ethernet and GPS domains along with data from other vehicle domains such as controls, dynamics, and battery management.

As an intern, you may also support other vehicle development activities which require connectivity support. These development activities may include drives in preproduction vehicles and will provide exposure to vehicle networks, cloud connectivity, and fleet management. An out-of-the-box approach and application of these insights will greatly enhance the development teams and will help deliver Rivian's focus on keeping the world adventurous forever.

Responsibilities

The connectivity integration intern will own the data analysis method and will provide:
  • A third-party perspective on telemetry data
  • A novel interpretation of observations
  • The ability to correlate meaningful metrics from disparate data sets
  • Engage in discussions to test, bug fix, and optimize feature development based on data
  • Provide insights and opportunities for performance and stability improvement
  • Deliver unique solutions and provide 'external user' influence and feedback
Qualifications
  • Pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineer, Computer Engineering or Electric Engineering from an accredited college or university
  • Preference is given to MS and PhD candidates
  • A thorough understanding of the OSI model, network protocols, and expertise with test tools such as Wireshark and nmap
  • Proficient with scripting languages including Python and/or Shell
  • Proficient with database manipulation and data presentation
  • A mindset geared towards collaboration and forward progress
  • Ability to thrive under pressure and time constraints, apply creative and critically thinking to deliver exceptional results
#LI-KC1

Equal Opportunity



Rivian is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Rivian is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Rivian are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Rivian will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Rivian encourages applicants of all ages.

Privacy



We take your privacy seriously. For details please see our Candidate Privacy Notice.
