Job Description:

Software Engineering Intern - Summer 2021

Job Location: Huntsville, Alabama, United States

Are you invigorated by digging for new and different solutions?

You’ll find an open playing field for your open mind and “adventurous” spirit when it comes to getting to the bottom of interesting challenges. We need critical and creative thinkers like you who are stimulated by possibilities and welcome the growth opportunities that new situations can bring.

Let’s talk about what you’ll be doing:

Parsons Corporation is seeking a Software Engineering Intern to support the design, development, and testing of the software integration of ground vehicle-based software systems and Small Unmanned Aircraft Systems (sUAS). Tasking includes:

  • Designing and developing software that interfaces closely with various types of hardware
  • Manual and automated testing of software
  • Designing and developing firmware
  • Working closely with electrical engineers and technicians to debug potential system issues

All activities will be designed to give the intern a full understanding of the engineering design lifecycle and insight into the role that Software Engineers play at Parsons. We are looking for interns with a desire to learn and passion for the field. Interns participate in the Parsons Internship Program where they interact with interns of varying disciplines and senior management within the organization.

When you brainstorm, there’s lightening. Join us!

You’re a champ at collaborating or brainstorming alone for new ways to tweak procedures and products or put a new spin on them entirely. You’re imaginative and keep up with market trends, always on the look-out for what could sharpen our cutting-edge. Here’s an opportunity to use your innovative mind to full advantage. We appreciate our diverse staff for the perspectives and skills they contribute. Here, everyone is welcomed, included, respected, and offered equal opportunities for advancement. Join us.

Required Qualifications

  • Must have proof of US citizenship
  • Pursuing a Bachelors (2nd year or above) or Master’s degree in one of the following disciplines: Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering
  • Major GPA greater than 3.0
  • Excellent writing, communication, and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work well in a team as well as independently
  • Experience programming in one or more of the following languages (C, C++, C#, Java, Python)

Desired Qualifications:

  • Experience with .NET Core
  • Experience with version control tools such as Git or SVN

We foster great, team-spirited collaborations

Our organization is truly a diverse community that’s open for everyone to participate in making a difference. If you want your insights and ideas to be heard and possibly enacted for your advancement and ours, you'll feel at home here. We value diversity in all its forms, and so here, you will find no limits to your professional growth. We welcome you into the process of exchanging ideas with work that is both stimulating and profitable.

Parsons is a leading technology firm driving the future of defense, intelligence, and critical infrastructure. By combining unique technologies with deep domain expertise across cybersecurity, missile defense, space, connected infrastructure, and smart cities, we're providing tomorrow's solutions today.

Ready to join our team as an intern this summer?

Description

Udemy is a global leader in education, and our mobile applications are a part of that story. Our learners and our instructors use the mobile application to find courses, watch videos, and communicate with each other about class topics. Our interns get to build features that real users will enjoy, while working to use modern techniques.

Responsibilities:

  • Working with other engineers, our product owners and designers, design and implement new features for the iOS application
  • Work with other teams to define appropriate APIs
  • Work to fix bugs found by our testers or in our production releases

Required:

  • Solid exposure to computer science fundamentals
  • Experience building an end-user application in any object-oriented language
  • Swift or Objective-C would be ideal, but any OO language is fine
  • Strong work ethicAbility to onboard in a likely remote-work environment


Nice to have:

  • Experience developing on a native mobile platform like iOS or AndroidExperience with RESTful APIs
  • Experience with standard development practices: code reviews, unit tests, git
About Udemy
We believe anyone can build the life they imagine through online learning. Today, more than 40 million students around the world are advancing their careers and passions by exploring and mastering new skills on Udemy, and expert instructors are able to share their knowledge with the world. Through our global marketplace and our solutions for businesses and governments, we connect people everywhere with the skills they need for success in work and life. We’re a close-knit bunch that enjoys problem-solving and collaboration, and we share a serious belief in the power of learning and teaching to change lives. Udemy’s culture encourages innovation, creativity, passion, and teamwork. We also celebrate our milestones and support each other every day.

Founded in 2010, Udemy is privately owned and headquartered in San Francisco’s SOMA neighborhood with offices in Denver (Colorado), Dublin (Ireland), Ankara (Turkey), Gurugram (India), and São Paulo (Brazil).

position: Software Engineer Intern, Data Recommendations Team (Summer 2021)
description:
Udemy is looking for a software engineer intern to join the Data Recommendations team for the summer. As a member of the team, you will be responsible for a variety of software development projects ranging from scaling the data infrastructure to setting up new internal data services/products to building and expanding frameworks that enable others to easily develop data pipelines. The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter with a passion for building software that meaningfully improves the lives of people around the world!

Here's what you'll be doing:

  • Build and integrate scalable backend systems, services, platforms, and tools
  • Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to solve complex data problems at scale
  • Identify and evaluate new technologies that improve performance, maintainability and elegance of our infrastructure
  • Contribute to a team culture that values inclusiveness and quality while fostering innovation

We’re excited about you because you have:

  • Strong knowledge of computer science fundamentals, including object-oriented design, data structures, and algorithms
  • Proficient with a programming language, such as Python, Java, or Scala
  • Self-driven, highly motivated, and able to learn quickly
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills

Preferred, but not required:

  • Familiarity with design and development of large-scale platforms and services
  • Familiarity with data processing frameworks and tools such as Spark, Hadoop, Hive, and Kafka
  • Familiarity with databases such as MySQL and Redshift
  • Familiarity with infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform, Ansible and Packer
  • Familiarity with developing end-to-end data pipelines
#LI-MC1

About Udemy
We believe anyone can build the life they imagine through online learning. Today, more than 40 million students around the world are advancing their careers and passions by exploring and mastering new skills on Udemy, and expert instructors are able to share their knowledge with the world. Through our global marketplace and our solutions for businesses and governments, we connect people everywhere with the skills they need for success in work and life. We’re a close-knit bunch that enjoys problem-solving and collaboration, and we share a serious belief in the power of learning and teaching to change lives. Udemy’s culture encourages innovation, creativity, passion, and teamwork. We also celebrate our milestones and support each other every day.

Founded in 2010, Udemy is privately owned and headquartered in San Francisco’s SOMA neighborhood with offices in Denver (Colorado), Dublin (Ireland), Ankara (Turkey), Gurugram (India), and São Paulo (Brazil).

Do you like working on a challenging project that draws upon what you have learned in your coursework? Do you relish working with a great team of people and bridging software applications to the physical world? Then, join our development team this summer. Fluke is looking for a Software Design Engineer Intern for our summer internship program.

As a Software Design Engineer Intern, you will be working with embedded and application software. You will be assisting in the development and/or test of cutting-edge firmware for the operation and control of instruments used in test and measurement, calibration, networking, or infrared imaging. Although Fluke is located in Everett, WA, the work will likely be conducted remotely, following COVID-19 guidelines.

Key Responsibilities

  • Research and/or develop a project as part of a multi-discipline team.
  • Design, code, test and debug software to support this project.
Required Skills:
  • College student pursuing a bachelor or advanced degree program in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.
  • Ability to take an active role in defining, designing, and implementing software solutions.
  • Ability to research and evaluate new technologies.
  • Ability to work in a team-focused development environment.
  • High level of proficiency in C/C++ programming.
  • Good communication skills.
Desired Skills:
  • Experience with scripting languages, such as Python or Perl.
  • Experience estimating work.
Fortive is a diversified industrial growth company comprised of global businesses that are recognized leaders in attractive markets. With more than $6 billion in annual revenues, Fortive’s well-known brands hold leading positions in field instrumentation, transportation, sensing, product realization, automation and specialty, and franchise distribution.

Fortive is headquartered in Everett, Washington and employs a team of more than 24,000 research and development, manufacturing, sales, distribution, service and administrative employees in more than 40 countries around the world. Our team grows by tackling challenges that accelerate progress and further their careers. With a culture rooted in continuous improvement, the core of our company’s operating model is the Fortive Business System. For more information please visit: www.fortive.com.

Fluke is leading the world in creating software, test tools and technology that will support customers today and in the future. We are a customer-obsessed market leader with a strong reputation for reliability, quality and safety.

A wholly owned subsidiary of Fortive Corporation (www.fortive.com), Fluke is a global corporation headquartered in the greater Seattle area. Driven by the successful Fortive Business System, Fluke offers the passion of a startup with the resources of a Fortune 500 company. We are focused on the growth of our individual employees, teams and the Fluke brand. "The company in which you have expressed employment interest is a subsidiary or affiliate of Fortive Corporation. The subsidiary or affiliate is referred to as a Fortive Company. Harbor Labs is currently seeking candidates for its Summer Internship Program. Qualified applicants should have at least an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related degree program. While the summer program typically comprises a mix of MS and PhD students, highly qualified undergrads with a skill set in computer programming or information security are also strongly encouraged to apply and will typically comprise some portion of the summer selections.

The program runs from approximately June 1 through August 1 annually, but can be adjusted based on candidate preferences and school schedules. Selectees for the program are expected to work for at least 10 weeks and will receive compensation for every week of service.

Summer interns will be presented with a diverse and challenging set of projects, each matched to the skill set of the individual. Interns will work directly with a senior technical supervisor, typically providing research, engineering, experimentation, and documentation in support of client requirements and the company’s business objectives. Past intern projects have included software design and development, database programming, web development, automated security analysis, manual security analysis, automated QA, cryptanalysis, firmware research, and medical device exploitation, among other duties.

Candidates will work alongside some of the industry’s foremost cybercelebrities, on industry-leading technology products, in a company well known for its technical leadership. The objective of the Harbor Labs Summer Internship Program is to provide aspiring security professionals with the introductory experiences necessary to strengthen their resumes and further their professional or academic careers in information security, while also performing meaningful work that contributes to the mission success of the company.

Successful candidates are expected to demonstrate technical depth, creativity and innovation in completing technically complex assignments. They will be given the opportunity to participate in limited business development and other customer facing activities. This is intended to expose the candidate to aspects of the sales, marketing, and business development components of a technology company, strengthening their professional skill set further.

Preferred education level: Currently enrolled in at least an undergraduate program in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or other related degree program.

Qualified candidates who may only meet a subset of these qualifications are nonetheless encouraged to submit their resumes for consideration.

Harbor Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All offers of employment are based solely on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. This hiring policy is reflected in the extraordinary qualities of the Harbor Labs staff. Race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, non-disqualifying physical or mental disabilities, and national origin are neither an influencing factor nor a consideration in the Harbor Labs hiring process.


Typical activities will include

  • Performing research in support of a senior cyberscientist
  • Working with senior staff to assemble a project plan
  • Developing ideas for solutions to cyber security problems faced by our clients
  • Conducting testing in support of client requirements
  • Designing, implementation, and integration of security solutions
  • Supporting the company’s line of technology products

Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in at least a Computer Science or Computer Engineering undergrad program, or other related degree program
  • Basic knowledge of computer science concepts, computer security concepts, and networking
  • Completed coursework in information security and computer programming is a plus

position: 2021 Summer Intern Technology Majors - Alpharetta / Marietta
description:
Position Description

2021 Summer Intern Technology Majors



Alpharetta / Marietta

Program Overview:

Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 7, 2021 August 13, 2020 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

Job Description:



Fiserv is currently looking for innovative and motivated Technology and Product Interns to participate in the 10 week 2020 Summer Internship Program. Technology areas such as Application Development, Global & Cyber Security, Mobile Solutions, Network Engineering and Quality Assurance are offering internships; each will provide training curriculum, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning.

Interns will work with Technology professionals learning much needed skills such as coding, testing and support application software; work with senior analysts and experienced teammates; offer innovative suggestions; participate in quality inspections; support in ongoing documentation of existing process, with mentorship, and other complicated projects. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment.

Qualifications:
  • Progress towards completion of bachelor's degree by December 2021 / May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement
  • Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)
  • Interest in learning and using emerging technologies (Mobile, payments, cloud computing, information security, and converging markets
  • Understanding of development processes and life cycles preferred (Waterfall and SCRUM/Agile)
  • Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge
  • Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills
Desired Technical Qualifications, expertise not required:
  • Microsoft .NET
  • C#
  • ASP .NET
  • Java Script
  • Java
  • C / C++
  • COBOL
  • JCL
  • Oracle
  • Linux
Majors:

A wide range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, MIS, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math), but willing to train the right candidate.

Learn more about Fiserv:

To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people arent thinking about financial services. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

Were Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The companys approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine Worlds Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran

Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

FSINT

Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet. Visit http://www.careers.fiserv.com/eeo for more information.

What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

Research Intern


AMD Research is an entrepreneurial research organization with a strong track record of driving research innovations into AMD products. We are a global leader in the development of the world’s most advanced high-performance computers (HPC), such as Frontier, the world-leading 1.5 exaflop supercomputer. As part of AMD Research, you will have a role on a winning team that works closely with government and commercial customers along with internal product teams and partners to develop the hardware and software technologies of next generation computing platforms, accelerating AMD to have the world’s highest-performing products.


THE ROLE:

AMD Research seeks a Computer Science or Engineering graduate student to work on high-performance computer software and hardware. You will be responsible for developing innovations that feed into scaled-out systems incorporating a variety of current and emerging accelerators and tightly coupled CPUs. The work has the potential to directly impact the current production software stack as well as influence the direction of future hardware and software.


AMD Research nurtures and encourages all co-ops to file quality patents and publish at top-tier research venues out of their internship projects. Previous co-op engineers at AMD Research have gone on to publish the results of their work in major academic and industrial conferences, file patent disclosures for innovative ideas as well contribute to production code and hardware designs.


#AMDRESEARCH

#AS-SWI

Country: United States State: California City: Santa Clara
Job Function: Student/ Intern/ Temp

We Are EA:
And we make games - How cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is. That's why we employ the most creative and passionate people in the industry.

Save the planet from Alien Invaders. Score the winning touchdown. It's the coolest job on the planet!

The Challenge Ahead:
Is to build our cross-platform, cross-game player network that encompasses EA Digital Platform (EADP) services including identity, commerce, marketplace, social, data & player experiences in a modern cloud operating model. This large scale, always-on collection of services powers EA's network of games that will be experienced by tens of millions of monthly active users. You will have an opportunity to build server-side systems that achieve new functionality to the platform, provide cloud enablement frameworks and cloud operation services to both EADP and game studios, and work on regular improvements to the systems to keep them at top notch performance.

The Next Great EA Software Engineer Intern needs to have:
Pursuing Bachelors' degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
Experience coding in an Objected-Oriented language
Experience with a public cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GAE, etc.)

Desirable Skills:
Web-based service development technologies, REST, JSON etc.
Design of multi-threaded architecture in web and data technologies

Over the coming years, biotech will fundamentally rewrite the way we live. Gene editing and cell therapy are dramatically changing how we treat cancer and other major illnesses. Biofuels and biomaterials are transforming the cars we drive, the clothes we wear, and the makeup of everyday objects. Crop science and synthetic biology are producing sustainable and ethical food. Benchling’s mission is to accelerate the research that propels us towards this reality, and magnify its impact, through modern software.
Every day, scientists around the world use Benchling’s applications, platform, & analytics in their efforts to solve humanity’s most pressing problems. For these scientists, Benchling is the central technology they use to conduct their research. Our customers include pharmaceutical giants, leading biotechs, and the world’s most renowned research institutes.
ROLE OVERVIEW

We're looking for a Product Design Intern to help ship creative solutions to complex product problems, helping to drive the biotech revolution. As part of this program, you will be in a position to grow as a designer and personally by working closely with your manager, mentor and an amazingly talented design team.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
  • Partner with PM and engineering to engage in user research, influence product direction, and define design projects
  • Actively contribute to evolving our process, tools and systems to ensure we’re creating great, consistent work
  • Solve customer problems by synthesizing behavioral information and imagining things as they should be, not as they are
  • Conceptualize a broad spectrum of ideas and then narrow based on experimentation and customer research
  • Rapidly design and prototype multiple ideas for product features
  • Advance a strong point of view, backed by personal expertise, design rationale, customer data, and industry trends
ABOUT YOU
  • Are working towards a Bachelors or Masters degree in Graphical Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or similar field of study
  • Have worked as a Product Design Intern or have similar experience
  • Have experience working with PM and engineering teams in a fast-moving environment
  • A strong portfolio of relevant design work that conveys an ability to ship successful products people love
  • Strong communication skills and ability to explain the reasoning behind complex decisions
  • Relentless focus on the customer
Benchling welcomes everyone. We believe every member of our team enriches our diversity and inclusion by broadening our ways of problem-solving for future challenges. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications for this job, we strongly encourage you to apply.
LEADERSHIP PRINCIPLES
  • Admit mistakes and shortcomings
  • Deliver results
  • Disagree and commit
  • Obsess over customers
  • Rely on work ethic
  • Show empathy
  • Recruit and develop the best
  • Sweat the details
  • Think and communicate clearly
  • Unite around the mission
PERKS AND BENEFITS
  • Work with a talented yet humble team
  • Competitive compensation & equity package
  • Quarterly mental health days
  • Weekly virtual social events, and annual company retreats
  • 401k, Medical, dental, and vision insurance (US Employees Only)
  • Monthly health & wellness stipend (Currently US Employees Only)
  • Yearly educational stipend (Currently US Employees Only)
  • To support remote work conditions, Benchling provides each employee a one-time stipend of $1,000(USD) upon commencing employment, and additional discounted employee purchase plans for home-office equipment.
In following best practices and safety protocols, all Benchling employees are expected to work remotely until we are further advised that it is safe for employees to resume work in their respective office locations.

With a spirit of challenge, we are committed to the continuous creation of new value. Fujitsu wants innovators like you!
Req ID:10460


We are seeking an undergraduate student in Computer Science (or related engineering discipline) for an internship in our Software Development organization in Richardson, Texas. As an intern you will be working in a team environment developing state of the embedded software for high speed optical networking equipment. Fujitsu’s equipment has an established reputation throughout the industry as a high quality product and is often the top choice of our customers. Come work with our team and participate in creating these products.


Work you will participate in:

  • C++ based application development on Freescale PowerPC based microprocessors
  • Debugging and testing of features developed for the networking equipment
  • Analyzing and resolving problems identified in our products
  • Installation, unit testing, and integration of various components/features within Telecommunication products


Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field
  • Software development skills, C++, Real-time OS, RDBMS, OOA, OOD,
  • Familiar with ClearCase or Git etc. code mgmt. tools, MS Office Suite (Word, Power Point, Excel, etc.), familiar with test automation, and at least one scripting language (Python, PHP, Perl,…). TCL/Tk, Expect etc.
  • Working knowledge of telecommunications products will help
  • Debugging experience with embedded software is a plus


At Fujitsu, one of our corporate principles is "We respect human rights." This principle underpins our corporate and individual activities and guides the actions of every Fujitsu Group member. We embrace diversity and equal opportunity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. By empowering people, we can unleash our collective strengths to create a better experience for our employees, our customers, and our partners.

position: 2021 Summer Intern Technology Majors - Alpharetta / Marietta
description:
Position Description

2021 Summer Intern Technology Majors



Alpharetta / Marietta

Program Overview:

Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 7, 2021 August 13, 2020 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

Job Description:



Fiserv is currently looking for innovative and motivated Technology and Product Interns to participate in the 10 week 2020 Summer Internship Program. Technology areas such as Application Development, Global & Cyber Security, Mobile Solutions, Network Engineering and Quality Assurance are offering internships; each will provide training curriculum, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning.

Interns will work with Technology professionals learning much needed skills such as coding, testing and support application software; work with senior analysts and experienced teammates; offer innovative suggestions; participate in quality inspections; support in ongoing documentation of existing process, with mentorship, and other complicated projects. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment.

Qualifications:
  • Progress towards completion of bachelor's degree by December 2021 / May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement
  • Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)
  • Interest in learning and using emerging technologies (Mobile, payments, cloud computing, information security, and converging markets
  • Understanding of development processes and life cycles preferred (Waterfall and SCRUM/Agile)
  • Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge
  • Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills
Desired Technical Qualifications, expertise not required:
  • Microsoft .NET
  • C#
  • ASP .NET
  • Java Script
  • Java
  • C / C++
  • COBOL
  • JCL
  • Oracle
  • Linux
Majors:

A wide range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, MIS, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math), but willing to train the right candidate.

Learn more about Fiserv:

To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people arent thinking about financial services. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

Were Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The companys approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine Worlds Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran

Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

FSINT

Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet. Visit http://www.careers.fiserv.com/eeo for more information.

What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

Research Intern


AMD Research is an entrepreneurial research organization with a strong track record of driving research innovations into AMD products. We are a global leader in the development of the world’s most advanced high-performance computers (HPC), such as Frontier, the world-leading 1.5 exaflop supercomputer. As part of AMD Research, you will have a role on a winning team that works closely with government and commercial customers along with internal product teams and partners to develop the hardware and software technologies of next generation computing platforms, accelerating AMD to have the world’s highest-performing products.


THE ROLE:

AMD Research seeks a Computer Science or Engineering graduate student to work on high-performance computer software and hardware. You will be responsible for developing innovations that feed into scaled-out systems incorporating a variety of current and emerging accelerators and tightly coupled CPUs. The work has the potential to directly impact the current production software stack as well as influence the direction of future hardware and software.


AMD Research nurtures and encourages all co-ops to file quality patents and publish at top-tier research venues out of their internship projects. Previous co-op engineers at AMD Research have gone on to publish the results of their work in major academic and industrial conferences, file patent disclosures for innovative ideas as well contribute to production code and hardware designs.


#AMDRESEARCH

#AS-SWI

We Are EA:
And we make games - How cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is. That's why we employ the most creative and passionate people in the industry.

Save the planet from Alien Invaders. Score the winning touchdown. It's the coolest job on the planet!

The Challenge Ahead:
Is to build our cross-platform, cross-game player network that encompasses EA Digital Platform (EADP) services including identity, commerce, marketplace, social, data & player experiences in a modern cloud operating model. This large scale, always-on collection of services powers EA's network of games that will be experienced by tens of millions of monthly active users. You will have an opportunity to build server-side systems that achieve new functionality to the platform, provide cloud enablement frameworks and cloud operation services to both EADP and game studios, and work on regular improvements to the systems to keep them at top notch performance.

The Next Great EA Software Engineer Intern needs to have:
Pursuing Bachelors' degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
Experience coding in an Objected-Oriented language
Experience with a public cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GAE, etc.)

Desirable Skills:
Web-based service development technologies, REST, JSON etc.
Design of multi-threaded architecture in web and data technologies

Over the coming years, biotech will fundamentally rewrite the way we live. Gene editing and cell therapy are dramatically changing how we treat cancer and other major illnesses. Biofuels and biomaterials are transforming the cars we drive, the clothes we wear, and the makeup of everyday objects. Crop science and synthetic biology are producing sustainable and ethical food. Benchling’s mission is to accelerate the research that propels us towards this reality, and magnify its impact, through modern software.
Every day, scientists around the world use Benchling’s applications, platform, & analytics in their efforts to solve humanity’s most pressing problems. For these scientists, Benchling is the central technology they use to conduct their research. Our customers include pharmaceutical giants, leading biotechs, and the world’s most renowned research institutes.
ROLE OVERVIEW

We're looking for a Product Design Intern to help ship creative solutions to complex product problems, helping to drive the biotech revolution. As part of this program, you will be in a position to grow as a designer and personally by working closely with your manager, mentor and an amazingly talented design team.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
  • Partner with PM and engineering to engage in user research, influence product direction, and define design projects
  • Actively contribute to evolving our process, tools and systems to ensure we’re creating great, consistent work
  • Solve customer problems by synthesizing behavioral information and imagining things as they should be, not as they are
  • Conceptualize a broad spectrum of ideas and then narrow based on experimentation and customer research
  • Rapidly design and prototype multiple ideas for product features
  • Advance a strong point of view, backed by personal expertise, design rationale, customer data, and industry trends
ABOUT YOU
  • Are working towards a Bachelors or Masters degree in Graphical Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or similar field of study
  • Have worked as a Product Design Intern or have similar experience
  • Have experience working with PM and engineering teams in a fast-moving environment
  • A strong portfolio of relevant design work that conveys an ability to ship successful products people love
  • Strong communication skills and ability to explain the reasoning behind complex decisions
  • Relentless focus on the customer
Benchling welcomes everyone. We believe every member of our team enriches our diversity and inclusion by broadening our ways of problem-solving for future challenges. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications for this job, we strongly encourage you to apply.
LEADERSHIP PRINCIPLES
  • Admit mistakes and shortcomings
  • Deliver results
  • Disagree and commit
  • Obsess over customers
  • Rely on work ethic
  • Show empathy
  • Recruit and develop the best
  • Sweat the details
  • Think and communicate clearly
  • Unite around the mission
PERKS AND BENEFITS
  • Work with a talented yet humble team
  • Competitive compensation & equity package
  • Quarterly mental health days
  • Weekly virtual social events, and annual company retreats
  • 401k, Medical, dental, and vision insurance (US Employees Only)
  • Monthly health & wellness stipend (Currently US Employees Only)
  • Yearly educational stipend (Currently US Employees Only)
  • To support remote work conditions, Benchling provides each employee a one-time stipend of $1,000(USD) upon commencing employment, and additional discounted employee purchase plans for home-office equipment.
In following best practices and safety protocols, all Benchling employees are expected to work remotely until we are further advised that it is safe for employees to resume work in their respective office locations.

At Virtual Radiologic (vRad) you make a difference. Your skills, energy, and passion for results drive us to achieve strategic growth objectives and deliver quality patient care across the United States.

Virtual Radiologic is a national radiology practice and leader in the development of radiologist workflow technology. The dedication of vRad team members enables us to sustain our unique market-leading position and to provide the best quality and service to our customers and the patients we jointly serve. vRad team members exhibit energy and a passion for service excellence in our casually professional and collaborative work environment. We continually reward team members who embrace our fast-paced culture and who go the extra mile for our customers with internal recognition programs.

At vRad you make a difference.

WE ARE CURRENTLY LOOKING FOR A SOFTWARE ENGINEER INTERN.

The Software Engineer Intern will aid in the design, development, testing and support of our database, server, web, and windows software applications.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Develop software within a team environment supporting a rapidly growing information technology intensive business
  • Review, analyze, and evaluate business and user needs and translate into software systems specifications
  • Participate in estimating, planning, and scheduling software development tasks
  • Participate in the design of software systems, user interfaces, web services, processing algorithms, communications methods, and other major components
  • Develop software in C#, HTML, JavaScript, Python, and SQL using standard coding practices
  • Perform unit, integration, and system level software testing
  • Assist SQA with integration and system level software testing
  • Participate in code reviews
  • Other activities as directed by management

Qualifications/Education:

  • In pursuit of an undergraduate or graduate degree in computer science or a related field
  • Experience with one or more of the following a plus
  • C# highly preferred (C++ or Java are acceptable)
  • HTML and JavaScript
  • Python
  • WinForms
  • WebAPI and MVC preferred (other MVVM architectures are acceptable)
  • Microsoft SQL preferred (Oracle or other relational databases are acceptable)
  • NUnit (or similar) testing framework
  • Microsoft Visual Studio
  • Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio
  • Developing software using Agile methodologies
  • Strong communication skills, written and verbal
  • Self-motivated and able to work on a team on independently defined tasks

ABOUT VIRTUAL RADIOLOGIC

Inspiring. Empowering. Rewarding. Fun. These are some of the words people commonly use to describe their careers at vRad – and are the reasons why we were recognized as one of the Top 150 workplaces by the Star Tribune in 2020, 2019, 2018 and 2017.

As a vRad team member, your main focus is quality patient care. At vRad, you’ll work with some of the healthcare industry’s most innovative minds on high-impact projects designed to move the practice of radiology forward. No matter what you do at vRad, you’ll play a part in shaping the future of radiology and patient care.

Internship Program Overview:

Our goal is to provide a meaningful and hands-on summer work experience in a high-growth start-up. This will be a full-time, paid 10-week internship program beginning June 14th.

  • Job Type: Full-Time
  • Compensation: $28/hr
  • Application deadline: April 16th
  • Final Decisions: May 15th
  • Program date: June 14, 2021 - August 20, 2021
  • Location: Remote

About Vouch:

Insurance... sounds slow, old-fashioned, and unexciting. Exactly. Insurance is broken, and it's failing fast-moving, innovative startups.

Vouch is a new, technology-first insurance company, backed with $100M in funding from world-class investors. Like Stripe for payments or Brex for credit cards, Vouch is creating the go-to business insurance for high growth companies.

We're doing this by making insurance fast, responsive, and focused on our customer -high growth and innovative companies. Instead of printed PDF applications and week-long waits, Vouch is building new technology to solve real problems, writing policies that actually cover relevant startup scenarios, and designing simple experiences in an otherwise frustrating industry.

Our values:

Put people first. Act like an owner. Listen, challenge & learn. Do the right thing. Thrive as one.

These values are at the core of our day to day interactions and are essential attributes for all teammates we bring onboard. We live these out in very practical ways in our approach to work, collaboration, work-life balance, and goals. We are people above all else and strive to take care of each other, respect each other, and encourage each other to do our best work together.


Role responsibilities:

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern to join us on the Customer Experience team. Our team builds all our customer-facing apps including our onboarding flow for new customers, quotes for insurance packages, renewals flow for existing customers, and member portal tools. You will contribute full-stack features to impactful, customer-facing pages.

Job duties:

  • Design and build full-stack, customer-facing features to power our insurance application and partnership integrations
  • Participate in brainstorming, retrospectives, sprint planning, and team game times!
  • Build features in React or Vue front-end codebases
  • Build endpoints in Node + TypeScript or Ruby back-end codebases

About you:

  • Recent bootcamp graduate or currently a junior or senior pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD in Computer Science or Software Engineering
  • Coding experience in Javascript (any of React, VueJS, NodeJS, etc)
  • Enthusiasm and passion for new technologies and interest in learning new skills

Stack we use:

  • React, Vue, GraphQL, TypeScript, Node, Ruby/Rails, PostgreSQL
  • CircleCI, Docker, LogRocket, Rollbar, Datadog, LaunchDarkly
  • Cypress, Jest, RSpec
  • AWS (Lambdas, SQS, ECS, etc) and Netlify
  • GitHub, Asana, Lucidchart, Miro, Sketch, Figma

Nice to have:

  • Exposure to and passion for early-stage startups and/or high growth environments
  • A background in insurance or other regulated categories

Vouch believes in putting our people first and building a diverse team is at the front of everything that we do. We welcome people from different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate the diversity of our growing team.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Job title Summer Intern 2021

Reports to Attorney

Location Arlington, TX

Harrison, McLaughlin and Associates (“HMA”) is a multi-state law firm that provides legal and advisory services to private investors, loan servicers, and financial institutions in the real estate and mortgage banking industries. HMA leverages its legal expertise, advanced analytics, and sophisticated technology to provide solutions tailored to its clients’ business strategies in such areas as:

1. Due diligence, valuation, and risk analysis
2. Asset management and vendor oversight
3. Mortgage default services, including foreclosure, bankruptcy and loss mitigation
4. Litigation strategy management

HMA is presently seeking Summer Interns to assist in the development of an artificial intelligence engine that uses machine learning techniques to recognize certain documents, extract critical data, and perform various applications relevant to the acquisition and processing of mortgage assets .

Who are you?

  • You are detail-oriented, flexible, and a quick learner
  • You are comfortable and efficient working with computers
  • You get tasks and projects across the finish line the right way
  • You can work independently once strategy is established
  • You are detail-oriented, flexible, and a quick learner
  • You like challenges of figuring out creative solutions to problems

What will you have to do?

  • Learn to recognize the documents and data sets on which we are training the AI engine
  • Review the AI engine’s output, determine whether it identified the documents and extracted the data sets correctly or incorrectly, and input those findings into an online database

What do you have to have?

  • Interest in pursuing a career in business, law, computer science or information technology is preferred
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Strong computer skills

- No programming/coding experience required, just the ability to competently navigate and work within various computer applications

  • Desire to learn
  • Willingness to ask questions and openness to constructive adverse feedback

Description

The PROS UX Team is seeking an aspiring User Experience Designer for our 2021 internship program. You’ll be mentored on a variety of techniques and tools from experienced User Research, UX Design, and UI Design professionals. You’ll get first-hand knowledge on what it takes to successfully collaborate in a design team. Plus, you’ll get practical work experience from a technology company creating advanced enterprise software products.

You may be the right person for this internship if you’re highly self-motivated and possess excellent time management skills. You should have a keen ear for coaching from senior team members and quick in applying it. Being articulate and observant is also essential.

We take the learning and development of our interns seriously. We have fun. We look out for each other. And we always get the job done. Come join us!

Responsibilities

We’ll adjust this internship’s responsibilities according to your skills, but may include the following:
  • Assist in design sessions with product managers, developers and others
  • Assist in user research activities, such as interviews or usability testing
  • Design workflows and prototypes based on business requirements and user research
  • Design high-fidelity user interfaces and interactions
  • Collaborate and integrate contributions from Researchers, Writers, UI and UX Designers
  • Write microcopy and other types of instructional text
  • Craft user surveys, analyze data and report results
  • Design and deliver presentations to an audience
  • Seek coaching and apply feedback from senior team members
  • Plus any other responsibilities deemed reasonable and necessary by management
About This Internship
  • Reports to the Director of User Experience on the User Experience Team
  • This is a remote internship with a workday based on the Central Time Zone
  • Starts June 2021 and ends August 2021
  • This is a paid position
  • This position is not engineering, marketing, graphic or print oriented
Qualifications

Must-Haves
  • Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s in Human-Computer Interaction or a related discipline, such as Computer Science, Web/Visual Design or Psychology
  • Depending on your educational background, demonstrated familiarity with any of the following techniques:
    • Contextual inquiry, interviewing, personas
    • Task analysis, heuristic reviews, usability testing
    • Sketching, paper or digital prototyping
    • Color theory, layout, design patterns, interaction design, typography
    • Content strategy, card sorting
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office
Nice-to-Haves
  • A basic understanding of common web technologies (HTML, JavaScript, CSS)
  • Prior internship experiences at software or technology companies
  • Demonstrated familiarity with any of the following types of software:
    • Sketch or Photoshop for digital design
    • Axure for prototyping
    • SurveyGizmo or SurveyMonkey for surveys
    • Statistical packages or Excel for quantitative analysis
How to Apply

Submitting a cover letter and an online portfolio with your application is required. Strong portfolios concisely describe problems, users, techniques, your individual contributions and results – regardless if your portfolio contains user interfaces, writing samples, or research reports. Portfolios may be submitted in PPT, PDF or online formats.

HEALTH[at]SCALE is a rapidly growing post-Series A healthcare machine intelligence startup founded by machine learning and clinical faculty with strong ties to MIT, Stanford, Harvard and U-Michigan. The company has been recognized for its efforts by Forbes, Becker’s, UCSF Digital Health Awards, Bloomberg, TechCrunch and MIT News. Our mission is to bring precision delivery to healthcare through cutting-edge machine learning and artificial intelligence that can predictively match the world's patients to the right treatments by the right providers at the right times. HEALTH[at]SCALE's machine intelligence platform and applications for care prediction are among the largest deployments to date of machine learning technologies for healthcare; helping leading organizations manage tens of millions of individuals in live production use. The company's software solutions service a broad range of use cases for managed care, accountable care and self-insured organizations, including: early targeted prediction and prevention of adverse outcomes, optimizing care planning and guiding effective treatment; refining and navigating provider networks; and reducing fraud, waste and abuse. For more information, please visit our website.

  • Experiment with cutting-edge high-risk and high-reward ideas and drive innovations underpinning the next generation of HEALTH[at]SCALE’s products
Requirements

Minimum Qualifications
  • Pursuing a degree (BS, MS or PhD) in Computer Science or related technical field
  • Strong track record of academic accomplishment and innovation
  • High levels of creativity and quick problem solving capabilities
  • Strong understanding of foundational computer science concepts and principles
  • Strong proficiency in Python (back-end) or Javascript (front-end) as applicable
  • Excellent communication skills

Our team matters deeply to us and we place great importance on maintaining a positive work-life balance and to empowering each other to maximally achieve our personal and professional goals. position: Computer/Software Engineer & Computer Science - Summer 2021 Intern/Co-Op
description:
Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges



The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isnt just about developing cool things. Thats why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

Join a team that designs, develops and integrates highly complex software applications within Honeywell. You will be an active and integral member of a team to achieve the completion of goals. You will also generate innovative solutions in work situations; trying different and novel ways to deal with problems and opportunities.

Use your skill set to provide value added software features to our products for our customers.
Accelerate innovation and growth, teaming with the world's most talented engineers.

We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Honeywell is the opportunity you've been looking for!

This position is available in multiple locations across the United States.

YOU MUST HAVE
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree from an accredited college or university in Engineering or Computer Science
  • Must graduate after December 2021
  • Must continue enrollment in degree program upon completion of the internship
WE VALUE
  • Understanding various software development lifecycle
  • Demonstrate the ability to develop efficient and high-quality software
  • Knowledge of software configuration management and change management practices
  • Diverse and global teaming and collaboration
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Effective communicator
  • Can quickly analyze, incorporate and apply new information and concepts
  • Ability to consistently make timely decisions even in the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness
  • Validated
    academic excellence (3.0 GPA and higher)

diversity conference this Spring? Honeywell will be there interviewing top

Engineering (GLOBAL)

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

We all depend on healthcare throughout our lifetimes, for ourselves, and our families and friends, but it is notoriously difficult to navigate and understand. As an industry that comprises 20% of the US economy we think healthcare should work better for all of us. At Collective Health we believe it's time for a new day in healthcare where as members we are informed and empowered to make the right care choices when the decisions are urgent and critical.

As an engineering intern at Collective Health, you'll develop systems that allow us to analyze trends, power our web portals, manage user data, process insurance claims, and keep our data secure. Our tech stack is a distributed system of Java, Python, AWS Technologies. Our infrastructure is based on Spark, Databricks, Airflow, AWS S3, AWS Glue. We've got a ton of interesting problems to solve around distributed systems, data, analytics and predictions, system reliability, security, privacy, and more.

Interns at Collective Health are involved in every aspect of our software development lifecycle, including designing systems, writing code, and deploying to production. As an intern, you'll be assigned a mentor who will help you learn about engineering at Collective Health and help you grow and improve as an engineer. Our engineering culture is collaborative and supportive, and we value learning from each other. We care deeply about diversity and inclusion and have worked to build a diverse team where everyone feels respected and supported.

About the team:



You will be working with a team of engineers that are responsible for the Data Infrastructure in Collective Health. It is a small dynamic team with a strong focus on data. You will learn to work with big data tools like Spark, Databricks, Airflow, AWS Cloud technologies in addition to Java, Python languages. You will be part of a team that is responsible for creating the next generation data infrastructure to move data to and from external clients, partners, and internal users with the goal of improving healthcare.

About you:



We're looking for interns who are proficient in an Object-Oriented programming language, such as Java or Python. We prefer interns to have completed at least one software development internship before who are passionate about data and infrastructure to solve hard problems for everyone. We are looking for interns who are willing to learn, strive to improve, and excited to make a difference in health insurance in the US.
Collective Health is a technology company simplifying employer healthcare to make health insurance work for everyone. With more than a quarter million members and over 60 enterprise clients—including Pinterest, Red Bull, Restoration Hardware, Box, Activision Blizzard, and more—our technical and customer experience teams are reinventing the healthcare experience for forward-thinking employers and their people across the U.S.

Collective Health is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, with additional offices in Chicago, IL, and Lehi, UT. Founded in 2013, Collective Health is backed by the SoftBank Vision Fund, DFJ Growth, PSP Investments, NEA, GV, G Squared, Founders Fund, Maverick Ventures, Mubadala Ventures, Sun Life, and other leading investors. For more information, visit us at https://www.collectivehealth.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Collective Health is committed to providing support to candidates who require reasonable accommodation during the interview process. If you need assistance, please reach out to recruitingaccommodations@collectivehealth.com.

Collective Health

About Wing:

Wing is reshaping the future of delivery. We are an on-demand drone delivery service that can deliver food, medicine or other items within minutes. We've also developed an unmanned traffic management platform to safely route drones through the sky. Our service is faster, safer and produces far less pollution than traditional delivery. Originally created in 2012 within X, the Moonshot Factory, Wing is now an Alphabet company.

About the Program:

Wing's Summer 2021 internship will take place virtually in the United States. This 12 week program is for students in their graduating year of school. We will review applications and interview candidates on a rolling basis until March 2021.

Students from all schools, and students who identify with a group that is historically underrepresented in the technology industry are encouraged to apply. This includes but is not limited to: Black/African American, Latinx/Hispanic, Native American, students with disabilities, veterans, and non-binary people.

About the Role:

Wing is looking for an intern to join the Perception team! The Perception team works on technologies that help drones perceive the world. We are focused on enabling capabilities to enhance vehicle safety and movability through advanced perception.

What You'll Need:

  • Proficiency in C++, Python
  • Familiarity with classical computer vision algorithms such as, Structure From Motion, 3D reconstruction, visual SLAM, visual odometry, depth estimation, depth perception
  • Familiarity with state-of-the-art techniques for analyzing images using deep-learning methods (e.g. neural networks for object detection, semantic segmentation, depth estimation, generative models).
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's, Masters or PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Vision, Robotics, Vision Systems or related field, with an anticipated graduation date after December 2021
  • Strong examples of hands-on engineering experience from university programs, internships, or student organizations

Bonus:

  • Passion for aviation, drones, or related technologies
  • Experience developing your own side projects with ideas you're passionate about

Note:

Participation in the internship program requires that you are located in the United States for the duration of the internship program. Individuals applying for this position will not be eligible for immigration sponsorship.

position: Intern - IT Software Engineer - IDR Modernization
description:
Our Vision: We make dreams possible.

Yes, we’re a student loan servicer. We’re also a technology company, idea incubator, start-up accelerator, and K-12 and higher education expert. Apply to one of our internships today. Your career awaits.

As of September 2020, we are planning to conduct our Summer 2021 internship program remotely. There is always the chance that we will return to the office before then. We plan to consider all candidates - even those who are not physically close to the Nelnet location or cannot re-locate.

In addition to your specific job responsibilities, you can look forward to strengthening your communication and collaboration skills through virtual meetings with a community of interns through the summer-long Pod Project.

Ultimately, you are not just an intern here at Nelnet. You are a pivotal, necessary addition to our teams. We are expectant that our summer 2021 program will be the best yet, and we want you to be a part of it. Whether you are an innovator, tech-expert, problem-solver, or beyond – you have the unique skillset to be a change-maker at Nelnet.

Software Engineer Interns will enhance and support our internal and external web-based applications. Interns will contribute meaningfully to a team that builds technology products. An agile team that is focused on developing software that provides significant operational efficiencies and a modern technology experience to our business partners.

  • Collaborate with technology experts

Position Description

Are you a college student or recent grad looking for an internship? Do you have a passion for marketing, social media, PR, or perhaps the business side of a growing marketing agency? Do you want to gain experience with a top shop and add some amazing work to your portfolio and resume?

A summer internship at Cronin will provide you a hands-on introduction to working at an advertising agency and the opportunity to be immersed in the craft of creating marketing campaigns for clients. Depending on the type of experience you’re looking to gain, you will get the opportunity to work alongside dedicated and passionate professionals in a wide variety of disciplines, including:

Account Management / Client Services – Responsible for the management of agency work and relationships with clients.

Social Media – Responsible for reviewing competitive trends and developing social media content for clients and the agency.

Public Relations – Responsible for the development of PR campaigns and media relations strategies, editing and updating promotional material and publications (brochures, videos, social media posts etc.), and organizing PR events and media coverage. Prepare and distribute press releases

Business Development – Responsible for increasing revenues, growth in terms of business expansion, increasing profitability by building strategic partnerships and making strategic business decisions.

Creative – Responsible for the design and execution of campaigns that encourage a target audience to buy a company’s products or services. The team is also responsible for creating a consistent brand image for the company through its look, voice, and messaging.

Video Content – Responsible for telling stories through video content, editing based on project scope or client needs.

Digital – Includes a variety of opportunities for candidates pursuing careers in web development (frontend and backend), digital project management, business/technical requirements/analysis, and quality assurance. Students currently enrolled in a computer science degree program with fundamental software development skills in the following are encouraged to apply: JavaScript, reactive frameworks, Jquery, CSS, HTML, PHP, WordPress or other CMS platforms.

Customer Experience & Consumer Insights Intern – Wide variety of opportunities to contribute to user, stakeholder, and consumer research (both qualitative and quantitative), user experience strategy and design, customer experience mapping and planning, and development of insights and analysis from above. Interest in both research and business strategy is key.

The intern program will provide hands-on advertising experience and opportunities to contribute to award-winning work and be a respectable addition to your resume or portfolio. Win / win.

Terms:

  • Duration of internship: June 7 – August 6, 2021, commitment of 20+ hours per week (Monday through Friday). All Internships are paid.
  • Must indicate which area you are most interested in above.
  • Must be currently enrolled in college at the time of applying. Open to rising juniors and seniors, new college graduates, and grad students.
  • Internship applications must be submitted by March 26, 2021.
  • Due to Covid precautions, this internship will be remote / virtual, so you can work from home in any location to participate.

position: AI Software Intern, Drive IX - Spring/Summer 2021
description:
NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company.” We're looking to grow our company, and build our teams with the smartest people in the world. Would you like to join us at the forefront of technological advancement?

We are now hiring interns for our DriveIX team, with a strong preference for those who can join in March or April.

Join our DriveIX team and help build the real-time, cost-effective computing platform driving our success in this exciting and quickly growing field.

Intelligent machines powered by AI computers that can learn, reason and interact with people are no longer science fiction. Today, a self-driving car powered by AI can meander through a country road at night and find its way. An AI-powered robot can learn motor skills through trial and error. This is truly an extraordinary time. The era of AI has begun.

What you'll be doing:

As a Software Intern on our Copilot team, you will be working on research, design and implementation of software features in the DriveIX and intelligent assistant. You will use machine learning, deep learning and computer vision techniques combined with rules-based domain specification to provide monitoring, communication/interaction and external perception capabilities using multiple different type of sensors and inputs on embedded platforms.

What we need to see:

  • Pursuing BS/MS degree in Computer Science/EE or related

  • You have strong fundamentals in embedded systems, programming and SW design

  • Strong knowledge of ML/DL techniques, algorithms and tools with exposure to memory networks, CNN, RNN and LSTM and/or Computer Vision

  • Have shown ability to harness existing data, acquiring and labeling of new data and managing related work flows.

  • Excellent fluency with C/C++ and Python

  • You strongly believe that prototyping is the right way to prove the idea

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Image, sentiment and object classification experience is highly desired

  • Experience with one of the following: dialog systems and conversational platforms, computer vision, signal processing

  • A familiarity with GPU computing (CUDA, OpenCL, OpenACC)

  • Familiarity with Dockers and Kubernetes

  • Familiarity with TensorRT

  • Worked with variety of vision, depth and audio sensors

  • Worked on programming automotive CAN bus

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world's most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Join our Intel Fab Construction Enterprise (FCE) who builds the world's largest semiconductor manufacturing factories across the globe.

The future is what we build. Our enterprise manages a portfolio of capital projects on-site with a large contractor workforce that encompasses outsourced general contractors, A/E Architecture and Engineering firms, and key trade companies in the Semiconductor Construction Industry.

We are looking for world-class diverse technical talent to join our team.

If you enjoy working with the latest technology in a rewarding, fast-paced environment, this is the right place for you. Everywhere you go, you'll find an opportunity to make a difference. In any given workday, you will be given the responsibility to innovate and create an impact on our business.

As part of FCE's Digital Transformation initiative, the organization is transitioning to cloud-based systems and technologies. This requires a completely different set of skills for laying the foundation to enable end-to-end systems for delivering fab construction cost, schedule, and predictability improvements.

This is a remote full-time internship.

As a Data Engineering Intern, the scope of our work includes the following responsibilities but is not limited to:

  • Progressive Build, tool Install, new factories, and site infrastructure.

  • Translate data into information and enable business strategy, improve operations, or otherwise unlock business value.

  • Tell a compelling story with data and visualizations that helps others see possibilities and solutions.

  • Software, data, and/or analytics skills to help implement solutions for construction-related projects, including developing new capabilities using Azure services.


Qualifications


You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience would be obtained through a combination of prior education level classes, and current level school classes, projects, research, and relevant previous job and/or internship experience.

This position is not eligible for employment-based visa/immigration sponsorship. Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's or Ph.D. degree, or a Bachelor’s degree with three years’ related job experience. This position does not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that only requires a Bachelor’s degree and less than three years’ experience.

  • The candidate must be pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a closely related field.

  • 2+ month of experience with:

  • Familiarity with Quickbase development and integration

  • Experience building SASS tabular models and writing basic DAX formulas.

  • Experience using the following technologies or programming languages: software and web development including APIs, Javascript, C#/.NET, and/or Python. SQL Server/Relational Databases, Microsoft BI stack (DAX, Power BI, Power Query).

    • Document new best practices and lessons learned.

  • Results-Oriented: Driver for successful challenging outcomes; self-motivated and directed; eagerly tackles new endeavors; willing to take a stand on unpopular ideas; strong conflict resolution skill set.
