Job Description

Get a glimpse of a rewarding careerat Intel.

Intel is in the midst of an exciting transformation, with a vision to create and extend computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth. So join usand help us create the next generation of technologies that will shape the future for decades to come.

Position description

Ethernet Products Group (EPG), within Intel's Datacenter Platforms Group, is one of the fastest growing organizations in Intel. We are now building the team of highly motivated network software engineers to change the future of Ethernet programmability through software defined solutions.

We are looking for smart and enthusiastic candidates who can help us in our journey to build high quality, efficient and scalable SDK and programmable solutions portfolio to our customers.

What you will do

In this role, you will partner with one or more senior engineers to develop, produce, and/or collect innovative tools, data, and insights that will help us design a software defined environment for Datacenter Ethernet product and IP's flexible packet-processing pipeline using P4 programming technologies.

The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:
  • Demonstrate initiative
  • Enthusiastic
  • Work well with your teammates and mentor
  • Documentation, written and verbal communication skills
This is up to 3 months internship.

Qualifications

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Must be pursuing Master's or PhD in Computer science, computer engineering or related discipline.
  • Minimum 6 months of Python, C, C++ development, object oriented programming, design and architectural patterns
  • Solid understanding of TCP/IP stack especially transport, network and data link layer
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Cloud software development
  • Intersection of software and hardware
  • Network protocols and driver development
  • Solid algorithms, data structure and programming paradigms (OOP, functional) skills
Inside this Business Group

The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intels transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologiesspanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutionsthat fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

Company Description


The California ISO is currently taking general applications for university or graduate students majoring in Economics or related fields for internship positions with our Short Term Forecasting team in the summer of 2021.

The California Independent System Operator (ISO) manages the flow of electricity across the high-voltage, long-distance power lines that make up 80 percent of California's power grid. We safeguard the economy and well-being of 30 million Californians by "keeping the lights on" 24/7.

As the impartial grid operator, the California ISO opens access to the wholesale power market that is designed to diversify resources and lower prices. It also grants equal access to 25,865 circuit-miles of power lines and reduces barriers to diverse resources competing to bring power to customers.

The California ISO's function is often compared to that of air traffic controllers. It would be grossly unfair for air traffic controllers to represent one airline and profit from allowing that company's planes to go through before others. In the same way, the California ISO operates independently—managing the electron traffic on a power grid we do not own—making sure electricity is safely delivered to utilities and consumers on time and reliably.


Job Description


What's In it for You

Our purpose is to lead the way to tomorrow's energy network. Your work as an intern can impact millions of people who depend on electricity for their everyday lives.

  • You will get "real world" experience to begin or further your career pursuits in the energy industry. This is a paid intern position for 10 -12 weeks during summer 2021.
  • You get to work on interesting and challenging assignments that will help grow your skill set.
  • You will work in an extremely collaborative environment inside our LEED certified Folsom, California campus.
  • Opportunities to interact with the CEO and the Executive team of the ISO
  • Invitations to seminars on the latest energy industry topics such as renewables, electric cars and micro grids.
  • Potential field trips.
  • Social activities with other interns such as barbecues and movie nights.
  • You get to work on our "green" LEED certified Folsom, California campus with some of the brightest people in the industry.

What You Will Be Doing

You will function as additionally to the Short Term Forecasting Team to the company by producing big data analysis looking at renewable resources, weather forecast accuracy, renewable forecast accuracy and learning more about how we translate model data into system load and wind and solar production forecasts for internal and external clients.

  • Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.
  • Applying knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization's goals. Work across the organization at evaluating over 400 renewable resources to improve processes of the new resource onboarding as we work towards 100% renewables on the system.
  • Gather and interpret various forecasting data to formulate short and medium-range forecasts critical to the bulk electric system. Validate and improve the accuracy of daily load, wind, and solar forecasts.
  • Conduct post-analysis to evaluate forecast accuracy. Seek to improve forecasting accuracy. Continuously improve understanding of forecasting developments within the meteorological field and the impact of such developments to the organization.
  • Research, develop and implement new forecasting tools and interfaces through the use of computer programming. Maintain superior computer skills. Create, maintain, and analyze weather databases. Enhance current or developing tools through knowledge of computer programming languages such as R, VBA, Python, Perl, etc. Evaluate potential inefficiencies in current procedures and seek improvements.
  • Provide statistical ad hoc analysis as needed. Collaborate with outside entities on forecasting projects and development of analytical tools.

Qualifications


Level of Education and Discipline

  • Currently in an Undergraduate, Master’s degree (MS) or PhD program in Electrical Engineering, Data Science, Meteorology or related field.
  • Graduating December of 2021 or later.

Amount of Experience

  • Previous internships, research or work experience using economic analysis is desired.
  • Research and or studies in energy industry highly desired.

Type of Experience

  • Forecasting and renewable generation knowledge
  • Knowledge of meteorological concepts.
  • Heavy Data Science background, able to run analysis on large sets of data to find correlations and improvements.
  • Knowledge of project management methodologies and best practices
  • Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people.

Desired programming languages

  • R
  • SQL
  • UNIX
  • C
  • C#
  • Python
  • NCL
  • PERL
  • Gempack
  • R
  • VBA

Additional Information


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

position: Research Intern – Software Engineer for Medical Ultrasound
description:
Job Title

Research Intern – Software Engineer for Medical Ultrasound

Job Description

In this role, you have the opportunity to

  • Provide high impact innovation in one of the most widely used medical imaging modalities – ultrasound

  • Interact with domain experts and build first-to-world solutions that have the potential to contribute to shaping the industry and affecting patient care in the near future

  • Strengthen your expertise in software engineering for ultrasound imaging scanners

  • Implement and validate novel algorithms for product release

  • Document the work and contribute to the publication of the work

You are responsible for

  • System implementation, testing, and optimization of signal and image processing algorithms for ultrasound imaging using C/C++

  • Documentation of system implementation/modifications

  • Reporting results to company and business stakeholders

  • Help the team build its knowledge in system implementation and C/C++ programming

  • If applicable, work with the team to draft relevant IP

You are a part of

You are part of a dynamic applied research team with broad experience in core ultrasound imaging and signal processing

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Computer Science/Electrical/Biomedical/Mechanical Engineering or Mathematics students at all levels are welcome to apply

  • Rich experience in programming, algorithm/system implementation using C/C++. Experience with GPU computing using CUDA is a plus

  • Familiar with basic signal and image processing

  • Background/knowledge in medical ultrasound imaging is preferred but not required

  • The successful intern will be self-driven and independent worker, but also able to interact closely with the larger team

  • Communication must be fluent in English, both written and verbal, to ensure constructive scientific dialogue.

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Are you interested in an Intern opportunity with Philips? We welcome individuals who are currently pursuing (or have recently completed) a BS degree to participate in a 3-month paid internship opportunity. Through this role, you will gain meaningful, hands-on experience working in a HealthTech company.

Contact



If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.

About Zapata:

Zapata computing is a software, services, and applications company making quantum computing possible for our Fortune 100 clients. We are pioneering commercial quantum algorithms, as well as the software platform and algorithms necessary to solve diverse enterprise-level problems such as complex global logistics optimization or groundbreaking chemical simulation and analysis.

We are committed to creating an environment that accelerates our researchers’ growth and positive impact in the world. Research here is fast-paced, highly collaborative, and cross-disciplinary. Our world-class quantum scientists, researchers, and programmers are creative, curious, and resourceful problem solvers with a revolutionary mindset.

About the job:

We are seeking creative, curious, and inventive problem solvers wishing to push forward their academic careers alongside our premier team of quantum scientists, researchers, and software engineers for a three to four-month summer internship. At Zapata Computing, we are breaking ground in the emerging area of practical quantum algorithms. Interns at Zapata drive research projects at the cutting edge of applied quantum computing. Some of our most exciting discoveries have been led by interns. As a research intern, you will contribute to our dynamic, highly collaborative, and cross-disciplinary research environment. We ensure our team has hands-on access to quantum hardware from both academic and commercial partners. We also support our team with ample classical computing resources from a high-end laptop to near unlimited cloud compute access.

Responsibilities:
  • You will help design and carry out a research project with a focus on publishing in leading academic journals.
  • Design, develop, test, maintain, and improve our implementations of quantum and classical algorithms.
While we believe your research will ultimately generate commercial value, you will not be assigned to commercial projects or be expected to participate directly in commercial activities. Day to day, Zapata seeks to enable large tracts of uninterrupted time with high focus. We believe that this, combined with opportunities for rich discussion and chalkboard time, is key for breakthrough science.

Example research areas include:
  • quantum machine learning
  • quantum algorithms for combinatorial optimization
  • quantum algorithms for quantum chemistry
  • Hamiltonian simulation
  • quantum error correction
Team values:
  • Cooperation in prioritization of work, science, and engineering decisions
  • Team success as a shared accomplishment with diversity in thought and experience
  • Open communication and willingness to respectfully engage with others
Minimum qualifications:
  • BA or BS degree in related field
  • Familiarity with quantum computing
  • Some experience using software such as Python, C++, Julia, or related languages
Preferred qualifications:
  • Currently enrolled in PhD program in related field
  • Record of creative, high-quality work​ represented by peer reviewed publications, code repositories, or scientific presentations
Location: Remote

Please submit your information and upload your CV and cover letter introducing yourself, explaining why you believe working at Zapata would enhance your research, and briefly describing a research topic of interest to you.

Zapata is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Tinder connects people. With tens of millions of users and a presence in every country on earth, our reach is expansive — and rapidly growing. Your daily work here will cause millions of people to spark new and meaningful connections. Our small, dedicated engineering team has one of the highest ratios of users to engineers in the industry, which makes every member of the team critical to our success. You'll have a unique opportunity to join a company with a global footprint while working on a team that's small enough for you to feel the impact each day.

About the role:
We are looking for a passionate and driven intern to join the revenue machine learning team at Tinder. Our mission is to monetize Tinder's global user base through subscriptions and premium features. Tinder has massive diversified users, and various revenue products to offer. Our team uses data driven approaches to understand user preferences, generate business insights, and shape revenue roadmap. Our machine learning projects cover conversion prediction, churn prediction, LTV prediction, and pricing optimization. You will help us explore a vast amount of data and derive knowledge to improve monetization. We're looking for a relentless problem-solver that can transform large amounts of data into optimized subscriptions and premium features, if this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

What you'll do:

    • Work on exciting problems on revenue machine learning with a focus on subscriptions and premium features
    • Collaborate with key partners to explore opportunities to develop data driven solutions by developing and utilizing statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms
    • Translate ambiguous statements into structured problem statements and testable hypotheses
    • Collaborate with a team of data scientists, engineers, and business partners to take an opportunity or problem from concept to scaled solution
    • Work closely with a mentor to develop a machine learning solution to further Tinder’s business goals

What we're looking for:

    • Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program pursuing a BS/BA, MS, or PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Physics, Statistics or other highly quantitative fields with a graduation date no earlier than December 2021
    • Prior internship experience and/or a relevant project list.
    • Practical knowledge of how to build efficient end-to-end ML workflows
    • Hands-on experience in designing and building highly scalable ML models
    • Proficiency in Python, SQL

Bonus points if:

    • Current MS/PHD in machine learning, statistics
    • Experience with causal inference and uplift modeling
    • Proficiency in big data frameworks such as Spark and Hadoop
Tinder's Summer Internship Program aka Tindership will be held remotely summer 2021

Tinder HQ is based in West Hollywood, California - most of our team works in the Pacific Time zone. but if you don't that's okay! For this role we're currently hiring in the following states:
- Arizona
- California
- Colorado
- District of Columbia
- Florida
- Illinois
- Michigan
- Montana
- New Jersey
- New York
- North Carolina
- Tennessee
- Texas
- Virginia

As part of our team, you’ll enjoy:

• Working on a product that has an immediate impact on people’s lives all around the world
• Collaborating with a team of creative, fun and driven colleagues
• Comprehensive health coverage, competitive salary, 401(k) employer match
• Other perks and wellness benefits like a fitness membership subsidy, paid concierge medical membership, pet insurance offerings, and a commuter subsidy
• Access to mental health resources
• Fertility preservation benefits
• No Meeting Wednesdays, an annual Learning + Development stipend, and access to a wide range of product and service discounts through Perkspot
• Charitable donations match up to $15,000 annually
• Monthly and weekly interactive virtual events including Book Club, trivia with prizes and yoga workouts
• The opportunity to join six active Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)


At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our product, and our community. We strive to make our workplace an inclusive and diverse environment, giving people from all walks of life the opportunity to have a voice. We champion and encourage those who bring different perspectives, ideas, and creativity to join our team dedicated to bringing people together across the globe. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we welcome all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, or other lived experience.

Overview:
FleishmanHillard’s St. Louis is seeking qualified candidates for a full-time paid Creative intern position. Interns are an integral part of our teams, giving participants real-life experience and skills that will help them succeed in their communications careers in the future.

FleishmanHillard believes a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives. We recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

Deadlines for Summer submissions: March 1
The internship is a paid, full-time position requiring a commitment of at least three months (May 26 – September 2, 2021)

Interested candidates must attach the following items to their online application upon submission:
  • Cover letter expressing interest in the internship program
  • Resume
  • Portfolio
  • Letter of recommendation from a former teacher, employer, supervisor, or personal reference (teacher or employer are preferred)
  • Transcript (can be unofficial)
Responsibilities:
ART DIRECTORS / DESIGNERS
Our Art Direction/Design Interns work under the guidance of creative directors with their artistic prowess to fulfil the design needs of clients. Having an eye for aesthetic is vital for success on assigned projects. They show us how they create something from nothing, how they visually bring an idea to life, how their process unfolds, and the results.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year graphic design or advertising degree or related program.
  • A portfolio demonstrating a strong sense of design and typography.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite.

COPYWRITERS
Our clients are in need of all types of writing: short form, long form, whatever the kind, it will be written. The Copywriter Intern should capture the voice of the client and tell their story the best way possible. They show us how to change someone’s mind with only words.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year advertising degree or related program.
  • A portfolio filled with conceptual ideas and smart copy.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

VIDEO EDITORS
Video Editor Interns work with directors and producers, being the tool that winds the story together, demonstrating the ability to jump from project to project, to find the shot that captures the moment, and to separate compelling content from filler.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed final year of a 4-year film, video production, broadcast journalism or related degree program.
  • A reel and/or work samples demonstrating strong technical proficiency as well as creative and storytelling ability.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
  • Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro and related programs.
  • Proficiency with videography and photography also a plus.

DIGITAL DEVELOPERS
Digital Development Interns get immersed into all aspects of development. They will see projects from front-end to back-end, the creation phase to the testing phase. They find what will work for a program and all its quirks. They are a problem-solver who loves finding that missing piece of the puzzle. The quicker, the better.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed a 4-year computer science or engineering degree
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, demand driven environment.
  • Basic experience with HTML5, XML, Ajax, jQuery and JavaScript.
  • Strong communication skills, including proficiency in developing technical documentation
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

PROJECT MANAGERS
Project Management Interns work directly with creative directors, account teams, and clients to see campaigns develop from start to finish. They demonstrate leadership qualities but operate best working with others. This position teaches the intern how to manage several tasks at once, oversee projects, and value the importance of being a collaborative leader.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed a 4-year business, marketing, or related degree program.
  • Ability to work under aggressive deadlines.
  • Strong leadership, management, communication and analytical skills.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office.
Qualifications:
This full-time paid summer internship is 40 hours per week that runs from May 26 – September 2, 2021 with the opportunity for extension.
  • Ideal candidates will have graduated and completed college coursework in journalism, public relations, communications or related fields.
  • Fundamental writing, research, communications, and critical-thinking skills
  • Ability to work easily in both large team environments and independently.
  • Prior internship experience at a public relations firm or corporate communications department; Prior internship experience where the role involved writing, content creation, social media, etc.
  • Demonstrate the ability to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
  • A positive attitude and willingness to learn from our industry-leading team of counselors.

About FleishmanHillard
FleishmanHillard is part of the Omnicom Public Relations Group, a division of Omnicom Group Inc., and has more than 85 offices in 30 countries, plus affiliates in 43 countries. Our award-winning agency specializes in public relations, reputation management, public affairs, research and analytics, brand marketing, digital strategy, social engagement and content strategy. We’ve been named PRWeek’s Global Agency of the Year and Best Places to Work; a “Standout Agency” on Advertising Age’s A-List; the Human Rights Campaign’s “ Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality”; and NAFE’s “Top 50 Companies for Executive Women” for a decade. We’re also more motivated by what we can give than what we receive, with a longstanding worldwide service commitment to support social inclusion in the communities in which we work and live. Visit us at www.fleishmanhillard.com

FleishmanHillard is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sex stereotyping, pregnancy (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, military or veteran status, alienage, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other protected class under federal, state, or local laws.

Please do not contact the office directly to apply – only resumes submitted through this website will be considered. If you need assistance reviewing career opportunities or completing an application, please call 314-982-6283 or email our careers team.

Santa Barbara Infrared (SBIR) is currently recruiting for the position of PART-TIME Software Engineering INTERN.

Santa Barbara Infrared (SBIR) designs and manufactures the most technologically advanced infrared and electro-optical test instrumentation available. SBIR's broad line of innovative products support testing of military and commercial sensor systems and are used worldwide in laboratory, production, depot and field test applications.

SBIR's focus is on providing well engineered, cost effective hardware and software solutions to the E-O community. Our extensive design capabilities cover the spectrum of infrared, laser, visible and dynamic scene projection applications. SBIR's proven systems engineering expertise combined with a practical, design-for-manufacturing approach results in production and custom instrumentation for the most discerning customers.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES - Software Engineer Intern

We are looking for a software intern to work on a wide range of aspects of our products. This work may include imbedded software development up to GUI work. Duties may also include software release management. This position requires someone knowledgeable in C, C++, and C#. Experience writing interfaces to devices is a plus as well as knowledge of SQL and other languages.


Requirements

REQUIREMENTS- Software Engineer Intern

Self-Help is a leading national community development financial institution headquartered in Durham, NC. Since 1980, Self-Help has provided $8.5 billion in financing to 159,000 families, individuals and businesses. It helps drive economic development and strengthen communities by providing responsible financial services; lending to individuals, small businesses and nonprofits; developing real estate; and promoting fair financial practices across the nation. The Self-Help family of nonprofit organizations includes Self-Help Credit Union, Self-Help Federal Credit Union, Self-Help Ventures Fund and the Center for Responsible Lending. Through its credit union network, Self-Help serves over 150,000 people in North Carolina, California, Chicago, Florida and South Carolina. Learn more at www.self-help.org, www.self-helpfcu.org and www.responsiblelending.org.


Internship Program:

Self-Help/CRL offers a 10 week summer internship program that is designed to give students valuable experience in a professional setting while broadening their knowledge of Community Development Financial Institutions (CDFI’s). Participants may also expand their knowledge of The Center for Responsible Lending (CRL) works which ensures a fair, inclusive financial marketplace that creates opportunities for all credit-worthy borrowers, regardless of their income Along with each specific intern project, the intern will participate in a series of brownbag lunches to learn more about Self-Help and the Community Development industry as a whole. Interns will also be given the opportunity to network with one another and other Self-Helpers through a variety of planned events.


Internship Description:

The Data Quality and Reporting Intern will support our cross-functional Data Intelligence Group to assess and improve the accuracy of data in our centralized reporting systems. Our data warehouse and other systems support the measurement and analysis of Self-Help’s impact in the communities we serve. One of our primary objectives is to ensure that all of our data systems provide accurate and timely data.

Your role will be to learn about the diverse data systems that are used at Self-Help, and perform analysis to identify sources of error in the data. You will write code to create reports and scripts that highlight data quality errors to analysts across the organization. You will collaborate with other teams to create workflows and processes that minimize the sources of error in their systems.


Essential Responsibilities:

  • Query databases and applications to extract data from systems.
  • Create reports and dashboards to measure data error and accuracy.
  • Collaborate with programmers and business users to write code that automatically detects errors.


Credentials, Experience and Skills:

  • Coursework in Computer Science; Information and Library Science; or related field.
  • Proficiency in using SQL to query and manage relational databases.
  • Computer programming experience in C#, Java, Python, or any modern programming language required; C# preferred.
  • Experience creating reports with Power BI, Tableau, or SQL Server Reporting Services preferred.


Physical Requirements:


Frequently requires use of manual dexterity and repetitive motions, primarily with the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. Must be able to occasionally lift and exert force of up to 40 pounds.

Business Group Highlights


Intelligence
The Intelligence group provides high-end systems engineering and integration products and services, data analytics and software development to national and military intelligence customers. Serving federal agencies and the Intelligence Community for more than 50 years, the Intelligence group helps our clients meet their mission needs by providing trusted advisors, leading-edge technologies, and innovative solutions.


Responsibilities

Do you aspire to support the Intelligence Community and Department of Defense? Do you want to learn from experts in the field and get a taste for what it takes to support national security and intelligence gathering? Do you have an interest in Space-based assets? Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced environment leveraging the latest technologies and advancements within the government? If this describes you, consider joining us as an intern!

We are seeking summer 2021 interns for our program supporting Perspecta’s Intelligence Group in Chantilly, Virginia. As an intern, you will work in a team environment and collaborate with other summer interns. You will learn about Agile methods and work in a Scrum Team. You will work on delivering an integrated platform for multiple intelligence applications in support of a real national Intelligence Community customer. You will explore different methods of software application containerization, cloud architectures, open source tools, trends and techniques to streamline ways to rapidly get data to users out in the field.

Meaningful work related to National Security

Additional Internship Information:
This ten-week paid internship program. We ask that each intern be available to work the duration of the ten weeks and commit to working a minimum of 35 hours per week. This program is geared towards technical college students that actively enrolled at an accredited university, who are rising into their senior year. Sophomores may be considered if they have declared their major and have qualified coursework.

Our intern program is designed to provide college students the opportunity to learn about Perspecta and gain meaningful, hands-on work experience in a professional environment. We place an emphasis on developing the next generation’s workforce. You will be assigned a manager and mentor. As part of our internship curriculum we provide the opportunity for each intern to interact with various organizations within the company. This includes the chance to participate in a corporate public speaking exercise, complete technical training courses, attend brown bag sessions with our executive leadership team and participate in teambuilding activities with mentors and fellow interns. Our goal is to build a roadmap that leads you to a long, rewarding and challenging career. We’ll work with you to help you determine your desired career path, and next steps to achieve your goals. You may also be given the opportunity to out brief your summer project to our federal government customer.

At RSM, interns work with large and small companies in various industries. They develop strong working relationships with clients built on understanding their businesses and challenges. As an intern, you will work on multiple team engagements each year, including several pieces of any particular assignment - not just one part. Working in a mutually respectful team environment helps our associates perform at their best and integrate their career with their personal life.

As an intern in the Application Development eCommerce practice, you will work with the team to learn and implement cutting edge interactive web applications for our clients. This includes front end web development for desktop and mobile devices, opportunities to contribute to design aesthetics, and backend development on some of the top eCommerce and Content Management platforms.

Examples of the candidate’s responsibilities include:
  • Take part in design and documentation of complete features as part of complex web applications
  • Create and maintain parts of enterprise resource planning (ERP) applications
  • Design and develop beautiful interactive web experiences that bring clients’ vision to life
  • Coordinate with client lead users and client engineering teams to test and implement new or modified programs as needed
  • Develop a deeper knowledge on proper coding technique

Basic Qualifications:
  • Pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS/IS or related field required
  • Strong conceptual, analytic and problem solving skills
  • Interest and experience in frontend or full stack web development
  • Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, and work on multiple projects simultaneously
  • Must be a team player and be able to effectively interact with staff at all levels of the firm
  • Travel to assigned client locations is required. Must have access to and ability to arrange for use of reliable modes of transportation to those locations
  • A minimum 3.0 GPA is preferred

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Hands on experience with modern eCommerce and Content Management platforms
  • Experience with any/all of the following:
  • JavaScript, advanced CSS and front end libraries / HTML
  • Java, C#, other full stack languages
  • Experience with source control, GIT, Agile development methodology
  • Hands on with Adobe Creative Suite
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work as an effective member of a team
  • Motivated to work in a fast-paced environment


You want your next step to be the right one. You've worked hard to get where you are today. And now you're ready to use your unique skills, talents and personality to achieve great things. RSM is a place where you are valued as an individual, mentored as a future leader, and recognized for your accomplishments and potential. Working directly with clients, key decision makers and business owners across various industries and geographies, you'll move quickly along the learning curve and our clients will benefit from your fresh perspective.

Experience RSM US. Experience the power of being understood.

RSM is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans.

The world is changing as we know it. It’s more important than ever that communications and entertainment services are available to users to connect wherever they may be. Here at Dolby, our mission is to enable experiences that transcend expectations and reach the spectacular. We need your creative solutions and diverse thought. The Dolby U internship program offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders.


Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. For any student seeking to gain invaluable expertise through meaningful, personal contributions, we invite you to join us in continuing to design a future where technology meets entertainment!


SUMMARY

Dolby Imaging Advanced Development team focuses on creating new technologies to improve the visual media experience. This team is the prime driver behind High Dynamic Range video technologies in the market, this team invented the Dolby Vision and its successful adoption in to consumer electronics as well as content creation industry. As a Software Intern in the CEG Imaging Device Product Engineering Group, the qualified candidate will help develop software that enables the next generation video technologies created by Dolby. The candidate hired for this position will be part of a team that works closely with Research group to develop proof of concept platforms, SDKs, plug-ins for external products, etc. The candidate will be responsible for wide range of activities such as graphics software development, mapping complex processing power intensive image processing algorithms to Mobile/Gaming/ PC/STB devices, interacting with customers, etc.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Analyze/Understand the breakthrough video concepts developed by research and provide feedback to research on the specifications and other technical documentation
  • Comprehend the reference code from the research with in-depth understanding of each module
  • Analyze and understand the system architecture of the SoC chipsets used in consumer devices supplied by partner companies and create high level design to map the Dolby technologies on their products
  • Create modular, well-organized and properly documented code
  • Optimize and customize the reference code to various chipsets designed using SIMD, GPU Shaders, etc.
  • Develop unit tests, regression tests and other test vectors to validate the implementations
  • Produce and maintain accurate documentation and software archives
  • Coordinate development activities with bothinternal members of the video engineering team, R&D, QA and selected external companies in a professional manner using latest software tools to enhance the communication
  • Continue to assess alternate IC platforms for suitability for implementation of Dolby video technologies
  • Participate and contribute to future concepts related to the Dolby video technologies and implementation vehicles for other Dolby technology

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Deep understanding of embedded software development and operating system concepts
  • Experience with C or C++ programming

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience developing image processing algorithms on consumer devices based on CPU/GPU flavor from different companies such as ARM, NVIDIA, Qualcomm, Apple, etc.
  • Experience in real time embedded software development or system software development using Android, Linux and similar CE device oriented operating systems and related development tools
  • Experience with optimizing algorithms using assembly, SIMD (Neon/AVX), GPU programming using OpenGL or DirectX, etc.
  • Experience with Android architecture, AOSP source code, iOS architecture, Gaming platform architecture such as PS4 or Xbox is a plus
  • Experience with MPEG-DASH, HDMI and DisplayPort is a plus

OTHER ATTRIBUTES

  • Ability to achieve results, meet deadlines, and adjust to quickly changing priorities in a fast-paced software development environment
  • Excellent oral and written communication, time management and organizational skills, and a thorough approach to problem solving
  • Willingness to work in a highly-skilled and cohesive team that is motivated to do high-quality engineering, promote an environment for open and creative thinking, and continuously build and share new skills

ELIGIBILITY

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, a related field; recent grads who are within 1 year of graduation are also eligible to apply
  • Must be available to work full-time Monday–Friday for 3-months between May/June 2021 –August/September 2021
  • Start dates for the internship are as follows: (*note* these dates are not flexible):
    • Monday, May 24, 2021
    • Monday, June 14, 2021
    • Monday, June 21, 2021
  • COVID UPDATE: This internship will be remote until further notice. Should conditions change, and we can safely allow employees to return to our campuses, there is a possibility of returning to onsite work.

Dolby will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code, Article 49, and Administrative Code, Article 12


Equal Employment Opportunity:
Dolby is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Our success depends on the combined skills and talents of all our employees. We are committed to making employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, marital status, family status, medical condition, disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances.

Nearest Secondary Market: Palo Alto

Job Description

Get a glimpse of a rewarding careerat Intel.

Intel is in the midst of an exciting transformation, with a vision to create and extend computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth. So join usand help us create the next generation of technologies that will shape the future for decades to come.

Position description

Ethernet Products Group (EPG), within Intel's Datacenter Platforms Group, is one of the fastest growing organizations in Intel. We are now building the team of highly motivated network software engineers to change the future of Ethernet programmability through software defined solutions.

We are looking for smart and enthusiastic candidates who can help us in our journey to build high quality, efficient and scalable SDK and programmable solutions portfolio to our customers.

What you will do

In this role, you will partner with one or more senior engineers to develop, produce, and/or collect innovative tools, data, and insights that will help us design a software defined environment for Datacenter Ethernet product and IP's flexible packet-processing pipeline using P4 programming technologies.

The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:
  • Demonstrate initiative
  • Enthusiastic
  • Work well with your teammates and mentor
  • Documentation, written and verbal communication skills
This is up to 3 months internship.

Qualifications

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Must be pursuing Master's or PhD in Computer science, computer engineering or related discipline.
  • Minimum 6 months of Python, C, C++ development, object oriented programming, design and architectural patterns
  • Solid understanding of TCP/IP stack especially transport, network and data link layer
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Cloud software development
  • Intersection of software and hardware
  • Network protocols and driver development
  • Solid algorithms, data structure and programming paradigms (OOP, functional) skills
Inside this Business Group

The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intels transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologiesspanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutionsthat fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

Other Locations

Virtual US and Canada

Data Stream Processor (DSP) is Splunk’s real-time stream processing solution that collects, processes, and distributes data to Splunk and other destinations at high velocity and high volume scale, on both our Splunk Cloud and On-Premises platforms. The Data Stream Processor UI team is building a rich application that provides a graphical interface that allows users to easily author, execute, manage, and monitor their streaming pipelines. position: Research Intern – Software Engineer for Medical Ultrasound
description:
Job Title

Research Intern – Software Engineer for Medical Ultrasound

Job Description

In this role, you have the opportunity to

  • Provide high impact innovation in one of the most widely used medical imaging modalities – ultrasound

  • Interact with domain experts and build first-to-world solutions that have the potential to contribute to shaping the industry and affecting patient care in the near future

  • Strengthen your expertise in software engineering for ultrasound imaging scanners

  • Implement and validate novel algorithms for product release

  • Document the work and contribute to the publication of the work

You are responsible for

  • System implementation, testing, and optimization of signal and image processing algorithms for ultrasound imaging using C/C++

  • Documentation of system implementation/modifications

  • Reporting results to company and business stakeholders

  • Help the team build its knowledge in system implementation and C/C++ programming

  • If applicable, work with the team to draft relevant IP

You are a part of

You are part of a dynamic applied research team with broad experience in core ultrasound imaging and signal processing

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Computer Science/Electrical/Biomedical/Mechanical Engineering or Mathematics students at all levels are welcome to apply

  • Rich experience in programming, algorithm/system implementation using C/C++. Experience with GPU computing using CUDA is a plus

  • Familiar with basic signal and image processing

  • Background/knowledge in medical ultrasound imaging is preferred but not required

  • The successful intern will be self-driven and independent worker, but also able to interact closely with the larger team

  • Communication must be fluent in English, both written and verbal, to ensure constructive scientific dialogue.

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Are you interested in an Intern opportunity with Philips? We welcome individuals who are currently pursuing (or have recently completed) a BS degree to participate in a 3-month paid internship opportunity. Through this role, you will gain meaningful, hands-on experience working in a HealthTech company.

Contact



If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.

About Zapata:

Zapata computing is a software, services, and applications company making quantum computing possible for our Fortune 100 clients. We are pioneering commercial quantum algorithms, as well as the software platform and algorithms necessary to solve diverse enterprise-level problems such as complex global logistics optimization or groundbreaking chemical simulation and analysis.

We are committed to creating an environment that accelerates our researchers’ growth and positive impact in the world. Research here is fast-paced, highly collaborative, and cross-disciplinary. Our world-class quantum scientists, researchers, and programmers are creative, curious, and resourceful problem solvers with a revolutionary mindset.

About the job:

We are seeking creative, curious, and inventive problem solvers wishing to push forward their academic careers alongside our premier team of quantum scientists, researchers, and software engineers for a three to four-month summer internship. At Zapata Computing, we are breaking ground in the emerging area of practical quantum algorithms. Interns at Zapata drive research projects at the cutting edge of applied quantum computing. Some of our most exciting discoveries have been led by interns. As a research intern, you will contribute to our dynamic, highly collaborative, and cross-disciplinary research environment. We ensure our team has hands-on access to quantum hardware from both academic and commercial partners. We also support our team with ample classical computing resources from a high-end laptop to near unlimited cloud compute access.

Responsibilities:
  • You will help design and carry out a research project with a focus on publishing in leading academic journals.
  • Design, develop, test, maintain, and improve our implementations of quantum and classical algorithms.
While we believe your research will ultimately generate commercial value, you will not be assigned to commercial projects or be expected to participate directly in commercial activities. Day to day, Zapata seeks to enable large tracts of uninterrupted time with high focus. We believe that this, combined with opportunities for rich discussion and chalkboard time, is key for breakthrough science.

Example research areas include:
  • quantum machine learning
  • quantum algorithms for combinatorial optimization
  • quantum algorithms for quantum chemistry
  • Hamiltonian simulation
  • quantum error correction
Team values:
  • Cooperation in prioritization of work, science, and engineering decisions
  • Team success as a shared accomplishment with diversity in thought and experience
  • Open communication and willingness to respectfully engage with others
Minimum qualifications:
  • BA or BS degree in related field
  • Familiarity with quantum computing
  • Some experience using software such as Python, C++, Julia, or related languages
Preferred qualifications:
  • Currently enrolled in PhD program in related field
  • Record of creative, high-quality work​ represented by peer reviewed publications, code repositories, or scientific presentations
Location: Remote

Please submit your information and upload your CV and cover letter introducing yourself, explaining why you believe working at Zapata would enhance your research, and briefly describing a research topic of interest to you.

Zapata is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Tinder connects people. With tens of millions of users and a presence in every country on earth, our reach is expansive — and rapidly growing. Your daily work here will cause millions of people to spark new and meaningful connections. Our small, dedicated engineering team has one of the highest ratios of users to engineers in the industry, which makes every member of the team critical to our success. You'll have a unique opportunity to join a company with a global footprint while working on a team that's small enough for you to feel the impact each day.

About the role:
We are looking for a passionate and driven intern to join the revenue machine learning team at Tinder. Our mission is to monetize Tinder's global user base through subscriptions and premium features. Tinder has massive diversified users, and various revenue products to offer. Our team uses data driven approaches to understand user preferences, generate business insights, and shape revenue roadmap. Our machine learning projects cover conversion prediction, churn prediction, LTV prediction, and pricing optimization. You will help us explore a vast amount of data and derive knowledge to improve monetization. We're looking for a relentless problem-solver that can transform large amounts of data into optimized subscriptions and premium features, if this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

What you'll do:

    • Work on exciting problems on revenue machine learning with a focus on subscriptions and premium features
    • Collaborate with key partners to explore opportunities to develop data driven solutions by developing and utilizing statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms
    • Translate ambiguous statements into structured problem statements and testable hypotheses
    • Collaborate with a team of data scientists, engineers, and business partners to take an opportunity or problem from concept to scaled solution
    • Work closely with a mentor to develop a machine learning solution to further Tinder’s business goals

What we're looking for:

    • Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program pursuing a BS/BA, MS, or PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Physics, Statistics or other highly quantitative fields with a graduation date no earlier than December 2021
    • Prior internship experience and/or a relevant project list.
    • Practical knowledge of how to build efficient end-to-end ML workflows
    • Hands-on experience in designing and building highly scalable ML models
    • Proficiency in Python, SQL

Bonus points if:

    • Current MS/PHD in machine learning, statistics
    • Experience with causal inference and uplift modeling
    • Proficiency in big data frameworks such as Spark and Hadoop
Tinder's Summer Internship Program aka Tindership will be held remotely summer 2021

Tinder HQ is based in West Hollywood, California - most of our team works in the Pacific Time zone. but if you don't that's okay! For this role we're currently hiring in the following states:
- Arizona
- California
- Colorado
- District of Columbia
- Florida
- Illinois
- Michigan
- Montana
- New Jersey
- New York
- North Carolina
- Tennessee
- Texas
- Virginia

As part of our team, you’ll enjoy:

• Working on a product that has an immediate impact on people’s lives all around the world
• Collaborating with a team of creative, fun and driven colleagues
• Comprehensive health coverage, competitive salary, 401(k) employer match
• Other perks and wellness benefits like a fitness membership subsidy, paid concierge medical membership, pet insurance offerings, and a commuter subsidy
• Access to mental health resources
• Fertility preservation benefits
• No Meeting Wednesdays, an annual Learning + Development stipend, and access to a wide range of product and service discounts through Perkspot
• Charitable donations match up to $15,000 annually
• Monthly and weekly interactive virtual events including Book Club, trivia with prizes and yoga workouts
• The opportunity to join six active Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)


At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our product, and our community. We strive to make our workplace an inclusive and diverse environment, giving people from all walks of life the opportunity to have a voice. We champion and encourage those who bring different perspectives, ideas, and creativity to join our team dedicated to bringing people together across the globe. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we welcome all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, or other lived experience.

Overview:
FleishmanHillard’s St. Louis is seeking qualified candidates for a full-time paid Creative intern position. Interns are an integral part of our teams, giving participants real-life experience and skills that will help them succeed in their communications careers in the future.

FleishmanHillard believes a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives. We recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

Deadlines for Summer submissions: March 1
The internship is a paid, full-time position requiring a commitment of at least three months (May 26 – September 2, 2021)

Interested candidates must attach the following items to their online application upon submission:
  • Cover letter expressing interest in the internship program
  • Resume
  • Portfolio
  • Letter of recommendation from a former teacher, employer, supervisor, or personal reference (teacher or employer are preferred)
  • Transcript (can be unofficial)
Responsibilities:
ART DIRECTORS / DESIGNERS
Our Art Direction/Design Interns work under the guidance of creative directors with their artistic prowess to fulfil the design needs of clients. Having an eye for aesthetic is vital for success on assigned projects. They show us how they create something from nothing, how they visually bring an idea to life, how their process unfolds, and the results.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year graphic design or advertising degree or related program.
  • A portfolio demonstrating a strong sense of design and typography.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite.

COPYWRITERS
Our clients are in need of all types of writing: short form, long form, whatever the kind, it will be written. The Copywriter Intern should capture the voice of the client and tell their story the best way possible. They show us how to change someone’s mind with only words.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year advertising degree or related program.
  • A portfolio filled with conceptual ideas and smart copy.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

VIDEO EDITORS
Video Editor Interns work with directors and producers, being the tool that winds the story together, demonstrating the ability to jump from project to project, to find the shot that captures the moment, and to separate compelling content from filler.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed final year of a 4-year film, video production, broadcast journalism or related degree program.
  • A reel and/or work samples demonstrating strong technical proficiency as well as creative and storytelling ability.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
  • Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro and related programs.
  • Proficiency with videography and photography also a plus.

DIGITAL DEVELOPERS
Digital Development Interns get immersed into all aspects of development. They will see projects from front-end to back-end, the creation phase to the testing phase. They find what will work for a program and all its quirks. They are a problem-solver who loves finding that missing piece of the puzzle. The quicker, the better.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed a 4-year computer science or engineering degree
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, demand driven environment.
  • Basic experience with HTML5, XML, Ajax, jQuery and JavaScript.
  • Strong communication skills, including proficiency in developing technical documentation
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

PROJECT MANAGERS
Project Management Interns work directly with creative directors, account teams, and clients to see campaigns develop from start to finish. They demonstrate leadership qualities but operate best working with others. This position teaches the intern how to manage several tasks at once, oversee projects, and value the importance of being a collaborative leader.

The Data Quality and Reporting Intern will support our cross-functional Data Intelligence Group to assess and improve the accuracy of data in our centralized reporting systems. You will write code to create reports and scripts that highlight data quality errors to analysts across the organization. You will collaborate with other teams to create workflows and processes that minimize the sources of error in their systems.

  • Query databases and applications to extract data from systems.
  • Create reports and dashboards to measure data error and accuracy.
  • Collaborate with programmers and business users to write code that automatically detects errors.

  • Proficiency in using SQL to query and manage relational databases.

Frequently requires use of manual dexterity and repetitive motions, primarily with the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. Must be able to occasionally lift and exert force of up to 40 pounds.

More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company.” We're looking to grow our company, and build our teams with the smartest people in the world.

What you’ll be doing:
  • Work closely with hardware engineers and other software engineers to design, develop, and debug many functional aspects of multimedia accelerator and mobile system-on-chip (SOC) devices.
  • Work with the early modeling and simulation required to produce our world-class products.
  • Exposure into Trusted Software and Secure Boot Software
  • Follow devices through the development process to the customer phones, tablets, desktops, notebooks, workstations, and gaming console products that are used throughout the world.
What we need to see from you:
  • Pursuing BS or MS in electrical engineering, computer science, or related field.
  • Familiarity with computer system architectures and hardware/software interface layer models.
  • Interest in low-level operating system knowledge, specifically memory/resource management, scheduling and process control, and hardware virtualization.
  • Kernel experience with Linux, C/C++, Scripting Language, Python, Android, Chrome, or Windows systems is useful.
What will make you stand out:
  • Knowledge in Security Topics and cryptography would be a plus.
  • Experience with sophisticated system-level debugging is invaluable.
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

All submissions MUST include GPA for consideration.

What you'll do:

Corvid Technologies is seeking an Engineering Intern with a strong interest in Linux. You will work directly with our HPC engineering team to build a small-scale high-performance supercomputer (Valkyrie). This project will be very hands-on, so be prepared to put together some computer hardware, lift some nodes, and get tangled up in some cables. If you enjoy learning, programming, playing with hardware, optimizing performance, improving efficiency, and enjoy spending time on the command line, this is the internship for you.

This project will be broken down into several subprojects and tasks consisting of the following:

  • Install, build, and configure HPC cluster master (including the installation of OS, CPUs, RAM, heat sink, hard drives etc.)
  • Rack and configure HPC nodes/hardware
  • Create and test custom-length CAT6 ethernet cables and wire the rack
  • Develop a private network to host Valkyrie using Gigabit and Mellanox InfiniBand switches
  • Install and configure HPC provisioner to boot stateless/diskless nodes (Warewulf)
  • Install Mellanox drivers and update firmware
  • Install and configure HPC job scheduler (SLURM)
  • Add cluster nodes to SLURM
  • Learn and master SLURM interface for HPC job submission, cancellation and listings
  • Compile and install 3rd party software on HPC network
  • Script repetitive tasks using languages such as bash or python
  • Submit jobs to Valkyrie and work with engineering team to test cluster configuration and proper implementation

Who we want:

We are excited about a driven, organized engineer with the right attitude and technical background, a desire to learn, and a passion for finding ways to be effective. To be successful in this position, a candidate will ask lots of questions and be motivated, results-based, detail-oriented, and live on the command line. Extra points for background knowledge in either structural dynamics and mechanics, numerical methods, finite element analysis, physics, mechanical engineering, or material science with computer modeling and simulation interests.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Masters Preferred)
  • 1+ year of scripting experience
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S security clearance
  • U.S Citizenship

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

position: Research Intern – Software Engineer for Medical Ultrasound
description:
Job Description
In this role, you have the opportunity to
  • Provide high impact innovation in one of the most widely used medical imaging modalities – ultrasound
  • Interact with domain experts and build first-to-world solutions that have the potential to contribute to shaping the industry and affecting patient care in the near future
  • Strengthen your expertise in software engineering for ultrasound imaging scanners
  • Implement and validate novel algorithms for product release
  • Document the work and contribute to the publication of the work
You are responsible for
  • System implementation, testing, and optimization of signal and image processing algorithms for ultrasound imaging using C/C++
  • Documentation of system implementation/modifications
  • Reporting results to company and business stakeholders
  • Help the team build its knowledge in system implementation and C/C++ programming
  • If applicable, work with the team to draft relevant IP

You are a part of
You are part of a dynamic applied research team with broad experience in core ultrasound imaging and signal processing

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience
  • Computer Science/Electrical/Biomedical/Mechanical Engineering or Mathematics students at all levels are welcome to apply
  • Rich experience in programming, algorithm/system implementation using C/C++. Experience with GPU computing using CUDA is a plus
  • Familiar with basic signal and image processing
  • Background/knowledge in medical ultrasound imaging is preferred but not required
  • The successful intern will be self-driven and independent worker, but also able to interact closely with the larger team
  • Communication must be fluent in English, both written and verbal, to ensure constructive scientific dialogue.

Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job. description:

About Foursquare:

Foursquare is the leading independent location technology company, powered by our deep understanding of how people move throughout the world. Our solutions help businesses make smarter decisions, developers create more engaging experiences, and brands build more effective marketing strategies.

Foursquare's platform includes Attribution, Audience, Pinpoint, Proximity, Places, Pilgrim SDK and Visits. As the industry's first and only accredited company for location data from the Media Rating Council (MRC), this foundation powers all our solutions — those that exist today and those we have yet to build. Over 14 billion consumer-verified place visit confirmations help us keep our map and models fresh and up-to-date, building a phone's-eye-view of the world with 105 million unique places of interest worldwide.

About our Engineering Team:

As a member of Foursquare's engineering team, you will gain experience building real products from the ground up. We're passionate about tackling tough challenges in the location space and look for others who like to dive deep into code and help solve hard problems.

Join us and help bring our feature ideas (and your own!) out of Slack and into reality. Here are some high-level areas you could contribute to:
  • Improve the accuracy and efficiency of one of the premier Place search APIs in existence. Our API powers Foursquare City Guide and Swarm as well as apps from Microsoft, Uber, Samsung, Twitter and more
  • Leverage machine learning techniques to build systems which process and derive insights from billions of location data points every day
  • Launch features that make cities easier to explore and continue to push the Foursquare City Guide and Swarm apps forward
  • Build resilient services and tooling which process petabytes of data and implement cutting edge machine learning techniques
  • Build scalable infrastructure to support rapidly growing products with enterprise level reliability requirements

Qualifications:
  • Currently, a rising Junior or Senior pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field
  • Solid foundation in computer science fundamentals with sound knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and design
  • Bonus points for any of the following:
    • Development experience in any of the programming languages we use: Java, Scala, Obj-C, Kotlin, Swift, Javascript or Python
    • Mobile development experience on iOS or Android
    • Experience applying ML techniques
    • Experience developing Yarn applications like Hadoop MapReduce or Spark
Foursquare is proud to foster an inclusive environment that is free from discrimination. We strongly believe in order to build the best products, we need a diversity of perspectives and backgrounds. This leads to a more delightful experience for our users and team members. We value listening to every voice and we encourage everyone to come be a part of building a company and products we love.

Foursquare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Description


Are you passionate about the chance to gain Software Engineering experience in a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad? Do you have the skills necessary to write well-designed, well-constructed, and well-tested code? If you’re a team player with the ability to complete all taskings an efficient and timely manner, then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!

What You’ll Do: The Software Engineering Intern is assimilated into a group to learn about and work under the guidance of an experienced manager. You will have the chance to attend senior management speaking events, participate in business networking, receive opportunities through scheduled events dedicated to the Intern population and gain invaluable professional experience through project-based work. It is an amazing experience to explore a career in one of the leading global financial information organizations as well as:

  • Work closely with a team of data scientists to create, design, and build a proof of concept related to the field of national and global security
  • Write well-designed, well-constructed, and well-tested code
  • Perform statistical analyses or create machine learning models
  • Present your progress at the end of the engagement
  • Leverage Thomson Reuters data to help understand and address an important U.S. government related data project.
  • Receive mentoring and advice from experienced data scientists.

About You:

You’re a good fit for the role of Software Engineering intern if you:

  • Are authorized to work in the United States without Visa sponsorship
  • Are a Junior or Senior undergraduate, Graduate student, or have a Bachelor’s degree in any of the following disciplines: Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, Basic/Applied Sciences, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field:
  • Have experience in coding in at least one of the following: Python, Java, R, Scala, C/C+
  • Understand computer science principles and algorithms
  • Possess basic knowledge of statistics (advanced statistics or machine learning principles is a bonus)
  • Communicate effectively (verbal and written) to different audiences
  • Continuously learn new skills and technologies
  • Are a good team player

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Job Description:

Are you invigorated by digging for new and different solutions?

You’ll find an open playing field for your open mind and “adventurous” spirit when it comes to getting to the bottom of interesting challenges. We need critical and creative thinkers like you who are stimulated by possibilities and welcome the growth opportunities that new situations can bring.

Parsons Corporation is seeking a Software Engineering Intern to support the design, development, and testing of the software integration of ground vehicle-based software systems and Small Unmanned Aircraft Systems (sUAS). Tasking includes:

When you brainstorm, there’s lightening. Join us!

You’re a champ at collaborating or brainstorming alone for new ways to tweak procedures and products or put a new spin on them entirely. You’re imaginative and keep up with market trends, always on the look-out for what could sharpen our cutting-edge. Here’s an opportunity to use your innovative mind to full advantage. Desired Qualifications:

We foster great, team-spirited collaborations

Our organization is truly a diverse community that’s open for everyone to participate in making a difference. We value diversity in all its forms, and so here, you will find no limits to your professional growth.
